review_comment: I first saw Cast Away last Wednesday Nov 21 and I expected due to its reward winning reputation that I would be pleasantly entertained and forfilled by this film After completing the movie I thought to myself Was it really that good spoiler Cast Away surprised me a little The acting was questionable in some scenes and the special effects did not seem to par due to some of the unimpressive CGI effects during the plane crash I didn t find some of the scenes to be too interesting either Let s face it Tom Hanks talking to a volleyball is not exciting Neither is him wondering around an island getting injured once and a while and then finally finding some dumb and unbelievable method to find his way to sea and become rescued The ending had its moments and was a twist that relieved the strain off my eyes from staring at a beach and water for an hour and fifteen minutes I took the ending as a positive part of the movie and felt it forfilled my expectations End of spoiler In the end this movie on the whole can be seen as boring I would not recommend this be shown to anyone with a short attention span it might be bad for your health Although I do have strong disgust for this film I won t treat it that poorly it has its ups and downs mostly downs Rating 6 0 10

Tom Hanks has yet again starred in one of the year s best films After a little film about the AIDS virus called Philadelphia Mr Hanks has been on a terrific film streak Well his new film Cast Away is another terrific eye opener about a FedEX troubleshooter Hanks who gets stranded on an island for four years after his plane crashed into the middle of the South Pacific Chuck s last words to his fianc e Kelly were I ll be right back A perfect touch to the film that tells you of things to come Chuck now must survive on his own both physically and emotionally without human contact and everyday devices that we all take for granted The first hour or so after the crash has pretty much no dialogue until Noland finds a package wash ashore The package contains a Wilson volleyball Well after Chuck cuts his hand in pain he picks up the ball and throws it It turns out the blood stain on the ball shaped into a perfect face Alot has been said about how stupid and unrealistic that a man would actually talk with a volleyball with a face on it for four years Well I ll tell you something picture yourself on a deserted island Got it Now here s the catch YOU RE ALL ALONE You got absolutely no contact with anybody and all you got is a volleyball with a face on it I don t know about you but I d go insane without anybody or anything to talk with Wilson was symbolic to the other part of himself He needed to talk to somebody or for that matter something about the things he s learned in life ideas feelings fears jokes stories and memories It s normal human behavior We need some sort of a social life It s impossible not to express your feelings with something so he vented with Wilson Let s also remember that he had a relationship with Wilson for four years That is a very long time The Wilson idea is very realistic and a perfect touch to the film Well after four years on the island Chuck goes through many changes his appearance and more importantly he has become much wiser Chuck also managed to completely conquer the four of the basic human needs food shelter water and clothing The film is about the human spirit and how strong it can become in difficult situations Cast Away is probably one of Robert Zemeckis Forrest Gump What Lies Beneath Back to the Future trilogy greatest achievements since Who Framed Roger Rabbit Robert Zemeckis is one of the most innovative and outstanding young directors and is definitely the future for directors and everyone should keep their eye on him along with M Night Shyamalan and David Fincher This is definitely one of the best films of the year and will leave you breathless For those who thought Gladiator was the best film of the year this means you the Academy what I ask is why Sure Gladiator was a great film and I liked it alot but Cast Away has a moral as did Requiem for a Dream which I personally thought was the best film of the year and will teach you to respect the things we take for granted like fire clothing a place to live etc So I believe that the Academy only gives the picture that was most popular the Oscar and that is quite sad Go see the film and learn to respect the things we take for granted 1 2 out of 9 10

review_title: The intangibles make the film and Hanks' performance
review_comment: POSSIBLE SPOILERS We are becoming increasingly hard pressed to find a better actor in Hollywood today than Tom Hanks Every movie of his is an event and a must see as was this one When this film debuted around Christmas 2000 I wondered if this film would hold up to the Hanks tradition of late He makes good choices of films to appear in and doesn t half anything from Philadelphia through Forrest Gump through Saving Private Ryan through this year s Road to Perdition This movie would not be the movie it is in my mind without Tom Hanks and his solo performance And let s face it that s what it is I can t think of any other role where one actor was asked to hold for screen by himself for scene after scene after scene like he did in this film What s remarkable about the situation is that he did it so well and in my opinion was robbed of the Best Actor award for 2000 by Russell Crowe s good but less demanding performance in Gladiator The movie begins in Russia where Chuck Noland Hanks is working He is a FedEx shipping supervisor whose life is ruled by in a word time The clock is his enemy his boss his friend when necessary and remains ever present in his life He is about to propose to his girlfriend Kelly Frears Helen Hunt back home in Memphis TN Before New Year s he finds out that he has to go on short notice to Malaysia much to the displeasure of Kelly He gives her the ring before he leaves without much fanfare and leaves for the plane On the way in a frighteningly scary and seemingly real plane crash Chuck becomes the only survivor of an awful accident and becomes marooned on a small unoccupied island There his personal odyssey begins At this point the film becomes something else It doesn t dissolve into typical Hollywood melodramatics and awful lamenting instead he struggles to survive through body and mind at once staringly longingly into Kelly s face through a small now broken clock family heirloom containing her picture and at another instance using his will to find food and survive with Kelly s face driving him As time passes and it becomes clear that almost nobody knows this island exists you can only imagine his man s internal musings about what life becomes isolation heartbreak beauty struggle and so on Being able to identify with Chuck Noland and be riveted by his predicament is to thoroughly enjoy the film for those bored by an utter lack of dialogue for more than half the film will be disappointed and I personally know many people who fall into the latter category Noland s character is not the type to expound on his feelings and at film s end he hasn t changed drastically but it is quite enough to feel for him as I certainly did Robert Zemeckis s direction is chock full of subtlety and the better the film is for it because scene after scene of over the top craziness good or bad for the characters doesn t fit the mood of the film and Alan Silvestri s hauntingly spare score for that matter Themes abound throughout such as the repetitive feelings about time and its absence on the island Some say the ending is disappointing but I disagree it makes perfect sense for the film s tone Overall see this for Hanks and his downright towering performance and also intangibles of Chuck Noland s thoughts Empathy is a huge bonus for the enjoyment of this film 8 10

after watching this movie once again after having watched this movie nearly a decade ago i was deeply moved by the whole plot and symbolism Few aspects that really caught my attention Wilson love the package Wilson was one of the core aspects to this film Spend enough time talking to a ball and eventually it becomes family Though i personally feel that having Wilson in the picture really was one of the only ways for tom hanks to have a conversation in the movie Nevertheless Wilson brought a whole new dynamic to the screen play Nothing more to add but to say the scene where he lost Wilson in the sea was so amazing yet sad to the extent of losing someone close to you His love for her was obviously strong and touching When reunited the two no longer had the space to be together anymore The reality of the situation is yet again so sad A woman who lost the love of her life has moved on while the man had survived the almost impossible Both are positive scenarios yet when the two unite again you actually feel worse for the lady i felt mixed emotions watching them two unite again As for the package that Tom did not open to me that package represented hope So long as the package is not opened there would still be hope or at the very least purpose the package symbolizes the unknown we all know that the contents of that package may very well useful to someone surviving on an island But to leave the package unopened means that there is at least a last resort To open the package meant discarding hope to ever leave the island In the end at the crossroads the lady in the truck yet again represented hope and whether or not Tom followed that lady or took another road that is up to interpretation To me he did not follow the lady because the lady represented the package Instead of opening the small package i think he would rather embrace the bigger package which is life that is full of uncertainty much like venturing into the sea when he was stuck on the island This movie is great seriously

Great acting from Tom Hanks this is the story about a FedEx executive that lived throu rules and schedules and one day his plans got destructed because of a twist of destiny A movie that would scare all those of racionalist thoughts how this could ever happen to me

review_title: In The Edge Of This World His Journey Begins
review_comment: Best Movie Since Forrest Gump This Is Amazing all the way i have seen this movie about 4times and its just getting better every time Just Make yourself a cup of popcorn cold drink turn the lights off and enjoy I Loved It
Tom Hanks do show his magnificent skills as an actor

review_title: Why Survive? For self and for the eternal motivator -- love!
review_comment: The central story Tom Hanks character surviving a plane crash being the sole survivor and spending four agonizing years surviving on an uninhabited island is well done After watching the film 3 o4 4 times some detail jumped out at me that I hadn t previously noticed or just wasn t paying enough attention There are two women overshadowing Hanks spiritual physical journey There is Kelly the love of his life who becomes a lost love with the passage of time Then there is Bettina first merely a symbol the orange wings on the one FedEx parcel that Hanks decides to hang on to in case he gets rescued Before his ill fated air trip the sign on the Texas Ranch says Tony and Bettina Over the passage of time Tony and Bettina who we do not see or know have become uncoupled just as Hanks character and Kelly are uncoupling because of separation Hanks is sustained by the pocket watch mounted photo of Kelly and to a lesser extent by the presence of the Bettina parcel Near the end of the film when he is back on the mainland he has to come to terms with the loss of Kelly while simultaneously if not knowingly opening himself to finding new love with Bettina Love lost love found An interesting juxtaposition This is as stated a more cameo part of the overall story but one which should not be lost sight of for what can motivate a man to survive against all odds is the possibility of finding new love to replace the one lost

The classic Zemeckis Hanks flick The kind of movie I knew was good from the first scenes with the long tracking shot of a FedEx package when the camera is glued onto it and the focus shifts on Tom Hanks character I was sold And I m not talking about the plane crash scene which was just impressive Look at the track records of Robert Zemeckis before the perfcapt movies and tell me he s not a good director The narration here works so well because it s always focused on something mainly Tom Hanks and never wavering and all the drama is channeled through him When you think about it there s only 1 character for 1h30 of the movie unless you count Wilson as a character and it s never boring Only the end felt a little flat Tom Hanks is basically mute and we don t really experience how what he s gone through has changed him In the end it s basically a very well made and thoroughly researched mass entertainment movie which of course has these little annoying merican narrative things Tom Hanks is SO good at his job he loves his wife SO much but it moved me so kudos

review_title: Never will a Volleyball make you this emotional
review_comment: OK So first things first this movie may not be for everyone especially kids Do not expect a movie filled with Adrenaline action romance If you are an impatient person who needs action and something to keep you occupied I do not recommend this movie If you have the patience if you can appreciate deep emotions without dialogue this movie is a MUST SEE This is a deep and emotional movie filled with loneliness And this movie will make you feel alone even if you are surrounded Tom Hanks finds himself alone on an island in the middle of the ocean with no one to talk to but Wilson He must find way to survive He is no adventurer or survivalist just a delivery worker How does he keep on going what pushes him survive Never will you be this sentimental about a Volleyball Wilson is a famous character for many reasons
It s a very beautiful movie about survival loss and letting go

review_title: You never know what might expect you...
review_comment: A guy used to live by the clock finds himself alone and with a lot of time to spend Tom Hanks great acting lets the movie run by smoothly for almost an hour and a half with no other characters than himself and a volleyball The final morale which is a little bit of a spoiler is that as he says You just have to keep on breathing Who knows what the tide may bring tomorrow I find it encourages to trust life s infinite possibilities

review_title: Symbols, symbols, everywhere. But not a jot of think.
review_comment: Yes Zemekis gives good value if symbols are what you crave They come thick and furious The Watch The Wings Fire and Toothache Whales and Sushi Trouble is he does nt really bother to charge up any of these symbols before he launches them They are like really lovely illustrations torn out of some old book They make one want to read the book But where is the Book I knew it was all over when during the kiss in the rain I looked over at my wife who cries at Pepsi commercials and saw her sitting their as dried eyed as a statue Now that was symbolic to me of just how deeply Zemekis had failed to draw us into the lives of these people Did I know who these people were Did I care No and no And Too bad cause I went into the theatre wanting to care I just really wasnt given any reason to

You ve read the synopses you know what the movie is about Let s get to the meat skip if you wish no spoilers Tom Hanks did a fantastic job of creating a believable character His acting was perfect for the role Up until his eventual rescue the film is excellent Sure we could have seen more of his decline into more primitive processes and it would have added to the movie The roundabout way his suicide attempt is introduced in the movie is effective The crash is harrowing His discoveries on the island are phenomenal His transformation into the lean thousand yard stare almost hopeless primate is wonderful he seems almost neanderthal in his reaction to the porta potty piece in the water loved it The movie after the rescue missed its mark Hanks discussion with his friend on the private plane had neither the stilted quality one might expect from someone whose sole partner for 4 years was a punctured volleyball nor did it have the possibly clamouring quality of someone who is finally around a lost friend I could expect either but instead we are treated to a rather bland characterisation In fact all of the interactions with others save the rather emotional monologue to the same friend later have this detached quality that TO ME seems inappropriate somehow This is almost painfully true in his interaction with his long lost sweetie played by Helen Hunt My problem is I can t seem to be able to imagine any real people when placed in the same situation who would act the way that both of them act Even the last chance part towards the end didn t have that emotion that one would expect in the situation Anyway I enjoyed the film but am still mildly disappointed with the points above I will still however probably buy it when it comes out on DVD Go figure

I had heard this was a pretty good movie with a weak ending On the contrary I thought it was a very good movie with an excellent ending The ending was not typical of Hollywood movie endings so I enjoyed it If you are looking for the Boy meets girl boy loses girl boy wins girl kind of plot so typical in todays movies then you will not like the ending If you can appreciate an ending you probably can t forsee you ll like it

review_title: a man that lived by the clock takes a break
review_comment: The story line was great and the ads were terrific I ve enjoyed nearly every film made by Tom Hanks He is an excellent actor but I was displeased with this film Hanks still did a fabulous acting job and if as one of the other commentors stated he would be nominated for an award he still deserves it This 2 1 2 hour movie could have been cut to 1 1 2 and still carry the same story line The reason that I scored this film low is that the second part of the film is so long and leaves you hanging and finally bored I actually yawned wondering if there was anything else to the movie besides him being stranded on the island There are scenes that show his progression but what about his family friends FedEx and the Federal Government It didn t even show the flight central or whatever they call them losing the plane from the radar and conducting the notifications They did a great job showing the transition from being Mr Busy to Mr Twiddle My Thumbs but there was a lot left out that would naturally be happening that could have had the audiance reacting or wanting to react to the scenes after the crash I think adding those other angles or viewpoints would have taken this film from being OK to great

review_title: I couldn't wait for it to be over
review_comment: Like comments prior to mine if you ve seen the preview you ve seen the movie It s not a thriller by any definition of the word You go in knowing what s going to happen and you just sit and wait for it to occur on the screen Save your money for something else

Robert Zemeckis and Tom Hanks have teamed up again to bring us a thoroughly entertaining new film in Cast Away While Cast Away does not bring us the magic that Forrest Gump did but in all honesty what really could it does however show us the incredible range of actor Tom Hanks It is hard to believe that this extraordinary actor got his start in such TV shows as Bosom Buddies Hanks in Cast Away spends much of the film alone so very little dialog is used except in moments of frustration and brief insanity where he talks to his new best friend Wilson Hanks must rely on his actions to convey his emotions and he does this beautifully In scene after scene he had me believing feeling for what he was going through Even in scenes that could have been ridiculous i e risking his own well being for a volley ball Hanks made me see the importance of saving this ball and pulled at the heart strings when he was unable to do so The movie itself falls short of a classic with an unsatisfying ending and a wasted Helen Hunt as the girlfriend he left behind but the real heart of this movie is Hanks and his fight to stay alive and that alone was worth every penny

SPOILER ALERT Ok I saw Cast Away and really enjoyed the film I ve seen a lot of comments suggesting that the end of the movie was tacked on and basically not finished This didn t really bother me as I sometimes like to come to my own conclusions The one aspect where I did wish the movie expanded was when he was actually rescued and reunited with civilization What did he do when they brought him up on the cargo ship Did he freak out when he saw people having been out of practice socializing for four years What food did he ask for Did he remember how to take a shower and shave I would have liked to see the movie expanded here as I m sure Tom Hanks would have portrayed the character very sensitively and unsure as to how to be civilized again

This movie has got to be one of the best movies I ve ever seen There wasn t that many lines so he didn t have to memorize much speaking parts but the facial expressions and the body movements are all part of it too and this movie would have been a flop without Tom Hanks Definitely The way he makes movies come alive and how deeply he is into them It s amazing I want to be an actress and I hope I m half as good as Tom Hanks He s my inspiration Anything you d like to say email me Thanks

review_title: The things we take for granted...
review_comment: I for one thought this movie was excellent I heard some cynical things about the movie before I went to see it but when the movie was over I thought it was one of the best I d ever seen I thought that nothing could scare me in movies anymore but the scene of the plane going down was terrifying and after the crash when he grabs the liferaft and surfaces the lighting effects are fantastic I give this movie a 10 and if you don t agree then obviously you are perfect and take nothing for granted

OK originally I thought that maybe I was just incredibly dumb but as I read the other user reviews I see that I m not the only one I didn t get the ending Just didn t make sense to me Why didn t he open the package on the island What s the deal with the wings on the package and the truck Didn t get it And also I thought that they should have showed more of him on the island I know that wasn t the primary focus of the film but rather his battle with control and time and such but that was the most entertaining part of the movie I thought we were kind of cheated when we saw the text Four years later I would have enjoyed seeing how he survived for four years Instead we go from him being on the island for about 2 weeks to 4 years later and I wondered How did he survive that long What did he do It was too big a jump Overall I was pretty much disappointed 5 10

We all knew that Tom Hanks was the greatest actor of our generation before this movie was released And again Hanks delivers the goods But were this a starring vehicle for any other actor this movie would not be the box office smash it is The heart of the movie Hanks fight for survival on a tiny Pacific island is brilliant What bookends the film however much of which has been ruined by another ad campaign that shows TOO MUCH pales not only in comparison to the rest of the film but in comparison to just about any other film Helen Hunt turns in a particularly uninspired performance with yet another sporadic attempt at an accent this time vaguely Southern that is as unnecessary as it is unconvincing Were it not for Hanks performance which will certainly get him a deserved Oscar nod this film would be easily set adrift by audiences

review_title: In a world that is tired of long movies, this could have been the exception.
review_comment: Watching this film left me and my friends thinking that maybe the butcher accidently cut off some of the meat while he was trimming the fat Tom Hanks did great but that is part of the problem I ended up wanting to know more about his four years Seems like the studio filmmaker whoever was a little too occupied with keeping the movie around 2 1 2 hours and not enough time giving us what we were hungering for Redeeming qualities Well let s just say Castaway features one of the best disaster sequences I have ever seen This movie would have worked much better as a 3 hour flick or a mini series Strange for me to say but that s how I feel

This movie had a lot going for it and I might have liked it a lot more if not for the trailer giving away too much of the plot Hanks and Hunt are fantastic their scenes together are touching and once they are reunited their awkwardness toward each other is felt throughout the audience It was incredible This film had fantastic scenery and cinematography especially the plane crash What I did not like was the ending What I wanted to know was what was in the one package that he never opened Wouldn t it have been nice for him to actually see that Maybe talk with the artist instead of their meeting at the crossroads For a second I thought I was watching the end of Thunderheart For a movie that opens on Christmas weekend I was hoping for a something for a little more uplifting This movie hurts you because the actors are that good This is not something I ll add to my DVD collection because the emotional content was too heavy Plus some of the scenes were drawn out a bit with a lot spelled out for you See it once expect a sad ending and you ll enjoy yourself

This movie was great They executed the plane crash excellently I laughed a lot in it too I m not going to give anything away but I think the ending wasn t good at all It wasnt enough for me But I would recommend going to see it

review_title: Oscar... meet Tom Hanks & Robert Zemeckis...
review_comment: Tom Bob meet ol Osc This scenario would only happen if Tom Oscar and Robert all had amnesia Why Because the threesome got acquainted back in 1995 when Hanks and Zemeckis worked together on Forrest Gump And Believe me you the magic is still there I just caught the film and let me tell ya it s worth every penny or frank or pound or rubel or whatever because where ever you might live You will love this film Being trapped on a desert isle is an old fashioned story I know yet so is a love story and so is a story of good vs evil And those stories show up all the time Why Because we like em We ll see who s right come this March Oh yes we will see indeed

After reading others reviews I ask myself Did they miss it or maybe this movie is not for everybody There are not many movies like this out there I really appreciated not having any music to add to the intense scenes it made the movie more real There is also a very interesting and deep emotional side to the movie that made a definite impact on me I don t mind the jumping around and not showing every detail the important things were shown He survived the physical and it was made to look easy compared to surviving the emotional To love deeply and to let go great tragedy and real living My words do not do justice to this great film 9 10

This is not a good movie It is very poor Couldn t wait for this film to end I am a Hanks fan I kept waiting for something to happen in this movie and it never did Hanks does a good job with a poor script Helen Hunt is wasted

In my opinion this was actually a film rather than a movie I liked it anyway To me a film is a movie where we are supposed to think about things A movie is simply meant to entertain In this film we are taken into the world of Chuck Noland a FedEx employee We learn that he is his job Time is his enemy He loves his girlfriend Kelly but to be together they must compare planners Then his world changes drastically He attempts to do things in his usual manner very quickly Time teaches him patience We don t learn about Chuck through dialog as much as we do through the lens There are scenes in the movie where we feel what the characters in the movie must be feeling simply by seeing endless ocean and endless prairie We also see the might of nature in stunning storm tossed seas and powerful winds If you are patient Chuck will tell you why he survived and then you will learn if he will survive If I say anything more it would spoil it for you This movie is 2 and a half hours long but it doesn t feel like a long movie I honestly didn t notice the time passing I do recommend this movie whether you expect a movie to challenge your thinking or are someone that likes to be entertained If you are like me you are probably both

This movie has many different points which can relate to normal people The way Tom Hanks acted in it is remarkable He depicted exactly how someone would respond to the environment alone I too would have probably started talking to myself and making up friends The one thing I don t understand about this movie is how it ended Tom Hanks was just standing in the middle of the road staring off into nowhere Other than that it was a decent movie I think Tom Hanks deserves an Academy Award nomination for this role

I cannot understand why people are touting Hanks for an Oscar for this movie Does not approach Forrest Gump or Philadelphia in any way shape form or fashion Just a boring movie about a man on an island making conversation with a soccer ball Tom was lost in this movie only it was not on an island Movie was too vague and left you hanging at the end If you were not paying close attention at the start you would not have even known that the name of the ranch had been changed by the time Hanks got there to deliver the package

Perhaps the aspect of this film that mostly impressed me is constituted by the few dialogues and the great silence that make this film unique It s well directed well performed and I think it has a good score too It isn t certainly a masterpiece but a good film It tells about the story of a castaway who manage to come back only four years later His girlfriend is married and he has to re start life Certainly Tom Hanks was more worthy of getting oscar than Russel Crowe

review_title: Renews Sense of Beauty to Be Alive
review_comment: I did not expect to like this film as much as I did More than anything it made me think about how much we have in life how much people take for granted I will never look at crab legs the same again Hanks continues to rule as the talented likeable star

review_title: Great movie! Another amazing performance by Hanks.
review_comment: I really enjoyed this movie I am glad that when hanks washes up on the deserted island they didn t load it up with all sorts of idiotic scenarios like pirates or savage natives or predators and such It is just Hanks trying to survive the best he can all alone He had plenty of time for soul searching to see what drives you to fight to stay alive It makes you wonder how you would have done it if you were in his shoes The ending was different also from what you might expect Its not all tidy happy ever after ending which I liked The reuniting of Hanks and Hunt at the end is very intense and touching that definitely tugs at you emotionally
Hanks is such a wonderful actor The storyline is interesting Sadly the final product is less than the sum of it s parts A few fewer Hollywood cliches would have held my interest longer

review_title: I enjoyed this movie, and so did my squeeze
review_comment: When I first saw the advertisements for this movie I had no interest in seeing it I thought Tom Hanks ego would do to this movie what Alan Alda did to MASH RUIN IT I was wrong and I was swept up in the film There is a love story to make the girls cry and enough cool stuff especially the plane crash to keep the guys from looking at their watches Besides I heard Hannibal was not that good

This is just a good movie Good pace perfect focus on characters perfect photography It is really interesting to notice that viewer reviews are VERY different from each other and focus on different aspects of the movie Clearly this movie contains MUCH more that it appears I did not like the Fed Ex commercial though Conclusion see it and possibly see it again

review_title: How many endings does one movie need?
review_comment: Zemeckis and Broyles deserve credit for a truly original version of a tired concept Robinson Crusoe Gilligan s Island Survivor etc The middle greater part of the film set on the island is extremely watchable never boring and often moving Tom Hanks is so acceptable to all of us as a sort of everyman one can t help but fully identify with this character in these circumstances Also I have to mention the plane crash is the most unsettling and I assume realistic I ve ever seen The one problem with the movie and I think it actually fatally mars the whole thing is the ridiculous ending s meant to spin some sort of sentimental closure I counted 5 possible endings and the thing kept going for 15 more minutes I think the studio was probably afraid of ending on an uncertain note so they just kept adding on until they reached the level of maudlin sentimentality they felt appropriate In actuality uncertainty would have perfectly matched the tone of Hanks character at that point in the film

There is no justice in Hollywood if this film doesn t receive academy award noms for actor director and picture to say the least If you want to see a film that will make you think this is the film for you I was spellbound by it and think I left the theater with something from this movie A better understanding of the morals of life

review_title: "This is a great catch, not to be thrown back"
review_comment: In the past years Tom Hanks has been one of the greatest American actors ever First Philadelphia then Forrest Gump Toy Story Saving Private Ryan and The Green Mile Now 11 months later Tom Hanks is in top form once again in which could be his fourth Academy award nomination for best actor and hopefully a best picture nod Those who are thinking Cast Away is just a one man Gilligan s Island are badly mistaken No coconut phones no wooden branch radios this my friends is the real deal Poor Tom Hanks trying to survive on this island in the middle of nowhere You owe yourself to see Cast Away

I saw Cast Away last night and must say that I was very impressed The fact that I am a fan of Tom Hanks probably helped me enjoy the film because I doubt anyone who does not like Tom Hanks would enjoy Cast Away being the fact that he is almost the entire film Cast Away is far from a perfect film as there are some minor and a few major holes in the story and sadly the script is not always up to scratch To be honest I was a little surprised that the film has so many flaws given the fact that the Australian media have been so full of praise In my opinion however Tom Hanks carries the film beyond these flaws and script letdowns and while Helen Hunt is not given much to do she is wonderful in the small screen time she has The first 25 30 minutes of the film is essentially fairly dull however it has a certain edge to it created by the viewer already knowing what is install for Hank s character The plane crash is one of the most amazing things I have ever seen on film I was actually not looking forward to the plane crash footage because I figured it would be nothing more than something the audience would have to endure before the real story begun However it was so good that I actually felt myself tensing up which really say s something about the footage because I rarely respond like that to anything on screen The cast away part of the story is equally brilliant because it could so easily have been unbearably boring I think many reviewers on this website are correct in their disliking of the way in which it cuts to four years later as it does feel as if Zemeckis took the easy way out in this respect My only other complaint about the cast away part of the story is Hank s escape off the island which did seem a little rushed in execution and generally not as dramatic with the exception of one moment but I won t completely spoil it as the events that had taken place before However this part of the film is by in large incredible and a work of pure genius from both Zemeckis but particularly Hanks Finally many reviewers here have complained about the last part of the film many suggesting that it went on too long However I did not find myself bored or restless during the last part of the film because I was generally interested in finding out what happens to Hank s character as he tries to re enter society My complaint about the last part has more to do with the script lulls because the film does not answer some of the bigger questions regarding this transition However like all of the weaker spots in the film Hanks carries the audience past them and it is his presence that makes this one of the best films since American Beauty released around the same time last year I truly hope that Hanks gets his third Oscar for his role in this film because quite simply I have not seen a better performance in any film over the last 12 months

Sometimes I think Tom Hanks gets nominated for too many awards so I was very skeptical of a long film about a Robinson Crusoe type film Sometimes it s nice to be surprised The direction was unconventional by focussing on his island stay rather than flashing back all the time and Hanks gives what must be one of his best performances making a very credible loner interacting with a volleyball You come out with an invigoration of the human spirit determined to have a fulfilled life whether we ever do is another issue

review_title: Think of people and things that you can't live without....
review_comment: I watched the movie one night while my sister was busy preparing her graduation admission exam in another room After it was over it really took me a while to regain myself and then I came up to my sister and hugged her closely and tightly Thank God We re here with each other And Xixi her name you know I love you Probably nobody can truly present how a man would behave when being cast away But I think Tom Hanks did a good job in this movie in both unimaginable and imaginable scenes What actually is this story about the basic needs of mankind the value of life itself the courage to survive despair hope and love the only salvation the beauty of our everyday life that should not be neglected how to define misfortune and fortune Points for us to ponder and many things for us to be grateful And to say to do to love to experience to live our life to the fullest

review_title: disappointment/suprised/could have been so much better.
review_comment: There were so many scenes in this film that dropped the ball Scenes that could have been dramatic Instead they went nowhere For instance as Hanks waded through the water cutting his feet on coral Blood was everywhere yet no sharks And why not switch back to what was happening at home People were leaving during the film and NOT COMING BACK This is no slam against Tom Hanks for he is truly gifted But the script clearly had problems Several scenes could have brought gasps from the audience brought suspense drama to the film instead the man beside me started snoring Too many set ups without going anywhere This was the very first time that I was disappointed with a Tom Hanks film In the cave a skeleton would have worked Maybe during the crash Hanks could have been saved by the captain then when Hanks was safe in the raft the captain could have been washed overboard and drown in the high seas Of course this is just my opinion but I was just so disappointed in this film I thought the ending could have been more dramatic and Hunt could have brought up the ring that Hanks had given her before he left She could have gone back to Hanks or maybe her husband could have loved Hunt so much that he actually sacrificed his own happiness so Hunt would be happy with the love of her life Oh well Sorry Such talented people involved yet I went away disappointed I don t think I was the only one

I was very disappointed after seeing this movie The story not being original see the book Robinson Crusoe by Daniel Defoe I expected much more from the playwright than was offered I could honestly say that I haven t learned anything from this film that I hadn t already known Even the moments that were intended to be dramatic and thought provoking were usually long and cliche as for the adventure side of the movie apart from a scene or two at the beginning the adventure and the thrill are missing almost completely Far from being a suspenseful thriller the movie leaves viewers wanting for more most of the time and eschews improvisation and the potential for action In short if you ve read Robinson Crusoe or even if you are a little familiar with the story then don t waste your time on this movie It really isn t worth your time and Tom Hanks s acting cannot make up for the lame scenario

review_title: A classic case of interesting story turned commercial
review_comment: Riding on the coattails of Survivor comes the movie Cast Away I had the same complaints with Cast Away as I did with Survivor Everyone wants to see a person sent to the naked edges of the Earth and observe the actions instinctive animalistic etc There needs to be more motivation than just survival In Cast Away Tom Hanks is stranded in the South Pacific which doesn t happen until well into the 30 minute mark a signature Zemekis move of not getting to the point The story if we disregard all that has happened prior to this is still interesting as hell Man against Nature in its raw est form Still Tom Hanks did a pretty good job It s not as good of a movie as I had hoped for but it s not without it s charm 6 of 10

review_title: Cast yourself away and SEE THIS MOVIE!!!
review_comment: I m sure that the grapevine has reached all of you with good and bad about this movie Instead of explaining the plot of this fantastic film which are available and excellently articulated in prior reviews I will explain how I never really left the theater that day I was looking forward to this film ever since it s trailer in The Grinch While I was sitting in the theater I was hypnotically transported to the island with our hero I was there making hatchets out of ice skates I was there bawling my eyes out when Wilson passed on I commend both Hanks and Zemeckis for their ability to entrance the audience I had begun to actually believe that the volleyball was really talking with Hanks character At first the idea was silly to me but within minutes I could almost hear Wilson talking Mentally I never left the theater Sure Chuck Noland was cast away but so was the audience When I physically left the theater I felt distant I felt like one person instead of a member of society I believe that s what Zemeckis and Hanks wanted you to feel The entire film was about realizing yourself It worked I look at this film not as a drama but more as a fantasy that every human being should wish upon themselves This movie was indeed a saga It was like a trilogy in one movie There will be no sequel There will be no prequel It s done The movie opened and closed stepping to the top of cinema history

review_title: An introspective look at the thematic implications of Cast Away.
review_comment: I am feeling well melancholy isn t perhaps the right word but close Pensive Contemplative I have been in this state for nearly 5 days now and this is my homage to that feeling this is my way of capturing it harnessing it As thoughts flood into my head I desperately try to write them down as quickly as possible but surely some will get washed away with the tide I have just returned from a movie that has altered or re affirmed my view of life and the world It is my second time seeing Cast Away and I am undoubtably changed Not so much changed but perhaps intensely more aware of what is important in life All my days equalling 22 years to this point have told me one day I would become but as I m growing to learn you never finish becoming as you learn more and more about life and the world you try things on for size and see how they fit you It doesn t end nobody taps you on the head with a magic wand one day and says ok you have become now go and live It is the living that fuels the becoming That said there are definitely defining times or moments when one feels themselves becoming faster or closer to who they think they are This was one such time for me watching Tom Hanks live out on screen my dream I really battle with the idea of who I am One day I think I know the next it has changed without warning Identity is so difficult because you can t have an objective opinion about yourself yet only you know yourself well enough to determine your own identity This leads one to the conclusion that perhaps though moulded by our nurture it is indeed our nature that is already planned out for us which we reveal piece by piece with each successive leg of experience and experiences in life One think I know for sure is I am meant for a simple life Not simple in that I am a simple person for I am one of the most complex people I know of but simple as in that is what I crave long for and have grown up to appreciate Despite my sometime wild dreams of wealth and prosperity down deep I realize the wealth I seek is wealth of life the marrow the experience and prosperity in making a difference on the world I touch The movie Cast Away has stirred something inside of me I need to remind myself of more often the value of simplicity the necessity to re evaluate what is really important and how much our antibiotic commercialistic technology driven society brainwashes us into thinking that if we buy into it we ll fill a void that can truly only be filled by God and self knowledge that comes from truly living This kind of living is one virtually unknown to our North American society but it is one based on need and necessity and not greed and desire And when it comes down to it truly all we need to live is faith sustenance purpose and above all else love When we stand at the cross roads of life there are many paths we could take and only one we will As Frost suggests I shall embark on the one least travelled My life awaits me along the path not at the end While you may think I haven t told you anything about the movie this is everything the movie has purged from me and so maybe I ve told you more than a plot summary could ever do If you want an opinion form your own by seeing it and experiencing it It may cause you to re evaluate your self and your life Remember the depth of the movie is only as deep as you allow it to penetrate and it s strength comes from understanding that it s Cast Away and not Castaway I know what I have to do now I gotta keep on breathing because the sun will rise in the morning and you never know what the tide will bring Tom Hanks in Cast Away

CastAway was gripping from start to finish I was very drawn into the story and I really cared about what was to become of Tom Hanks character Hanks by the way was brilliant yet again and showed his fantastic talent even in a film with limited dialogue and interaction with other characters The film direction and cinematography were also outstanding and the plane crash sequence was well very intense to say the least Overall it was a very good movie with an engaging and engrossing story superb acting and a great message to end the film Check it out it s worth it

After four years alone on an island you would think that the main character could make himself a more comfortable bed an perhaps have painted at least a few more pictures on the wall of his cave Mostly impressive for the lead s performance and weight loss

I thought Cast Away was simply incredible What I liked most about this movie was the way it handled the situation and its cinematography First I believe if someone were to be stranded there situation would be played out similar to Chuck s No pirates natives snakes buddies abundant food supplies and other plot devices every other movie of this genre uses It is a man alone on a small island left to himself and a volleyball Hanks played this part so convincingly I felt as if his character was always just teetering on the edge of insanity Myself and others I saw this movie with felt real sorrow when Chuck loses Wilson I felt this movie had a very strong ending I believe it ended at the right point We see how Chuck adjusts but what he decides to do with his life is left up the the viewers imagination I also believed the cinematography was spectacular Granted anything filmed in the South Pacific will look beautiful the filming in this movie captures the feeling of being on the tiny island with Chuck Four stars

It is a nod to Tom Hanks talent that for the majority of Cast Away the only other object or thing in the movie is a volleyball I m sure there will be wags who will glibly compare Cast Away to the likes of Gilligan s Island and Survivor but in tone approach and overall accomplishment this atypical Robinson Crusoe tale bears a strong resemblance to one of director Robert Zemeckis earlier efforts Contact No Cast Away isn t about space or messages from another planet but at its core neither was Contact Both films ask the same crucial existential question one that Shakespeare pondered for years taking all things into account what does it mean to be human How do we cope with loss hopelessness and isolation and still find the courage to face the next day The love and dream of a dead father sustained Jodie Foster s character in Contact For Tom Hanks Chuck Noland in Cast Away it is the promise offered by the smile of his equally absent and equally beloved wife to be A magical experience

He found the island that I ve wished my whole life I could wash up on just kidding But it would be nice to get away for a while wouldn t it Cast Away was great I think Although like so many others it took me a minute to figure out why he took 4 years to escape duh the Port a Potty provided him with a sail got him past the reef breakers out on the open sea my apologies to anyone who has already mentioned this fact I didn t really read all 312 reviews before mine This has been such a bad year overall for films it was great to see such a wonderful piece of drama

The acting was amazing and I believe it will garner Tom Hanks his next oscar The film overall disappointed both my wife and me as we were expecting more from the story More detail more scenes from the island more about how he survived Most of all we want to know what was in the package he delivered to the woman in Shamrock TX

review_title: Too far away from good movie...
review_comment: This is the worse movie of Robert Zemekis Three parts of movie life before crush and living on island life on island and return in normal life after The most interesting part is second but watching third part I was very bored Too much sentimentality and melancholy make movie look like chewing gum without a taste Maybe movie is only for Americans

You like this movie because TOM HANKS is in it Take away Tom Hanks and you would be spitting foul words with disgrace as you leave the theater And for those who disagree please honestly answer yourself this one question Are you lonely Are you connecting with this movie because you see yourself as Hanks all alone and castaway Someday when you are no longer alone re watch this movie and see for yourself what a DULL BORING NOTHING movie this is

review_title: Good, but it could have been better...
review_comment: The narrative is just fine and Tom Hanks is wonderful as usual The film fails in structure All too often frame stories fail somewhere along the line Either the frame is stronger than the middle or as in this case the middle is stronger than the frame story The beginning and end could have been reshaped or deleted and the story would have been all the better for it The frame feels tacked on almost As I watched it I felt as if i were watching a great film just screaming to be let out of this miserable structure And I am of the opinion that if you are going to cast Helen Hunt you don t waste her time and ours by only using her for a 30 minute role She is too wonderful an actress for such a minor and thankless role

review_title: A bright, shiny package with nothing inside.
review_comment: There is nothing below the shiny surface of this movie what did Hanks character really cast away He finds no perspective on his life or situation other than a similarity to tidal vicissitudes He discovers no spirituality of any kind not even when he buries the man who saved his life He relates to a ball better than he ever did to his girlfriend or to her memory what does that teach him Nothing that we can see The strengths he is forced to find in his solitude are a mystery to us besides making fire it s therefore a mystery as to how well or how badly these all important basic strengths translate to his real life or to his new self So again I ask what was cast away what was found His bland relationship with Hunt s character That s it Seems he should ve discovered cast away a lot more on that island therefore returned home a richer man Are we ever asked what is really hidden in every man s heart underlying civilization Or what use or meaning there is in a single solitary life Oddly no I found the film sadly strangely void A deserted island is so fertile as a dramatic device yet it simply framed a film that itself felt deserted

the movie has a lot of meanings regarding humanity and how to be determinant also how to appreciate time The most important thing is that a man should have a principal in life to fight for whatever happened or else why do we live thanks to Tom and Zemeckis

review_title: Excellent production and splendid settings. Good performance.
review_comment: The story line was not hard to follow and was very interesting but it is very hard to stuff any more since it was already 3 hours long The viewer s imagination was needed to fill in the rest of the sage This film was very hard to work on the outdoor sets The realities of island living are brutal and difficult to portray Much of the hardships were left out of the film Anyone who watched Gilligan s Island would have thought otherwise Tom Hanks carried the film on his back and did much better than expected I agree with most other comments about desiring to see more scenes about Chuck Nolans integration back into society I expected more makeup work to display a variety of skin diseases rashes infections and at least a skin peeling sunburn The island scenes captured his injuries well and helped the audience with much of the painful side of the experience especially the bad tooth scene in the cave The film needed more pain It was too sterile after the rescue
It s really special work from the legend hanx I feel good after this watched this one

Tom Hanks was able to carry the movie with no other actors for much of the movie This is a difficult task to pull off so well because actors generally rely on each other for drama It is hard for one actor to hold the audience attention for such a long time without resorting to overly broad strokes Hanks was able to hold the audience attention without giving way to self consciousness He has proven himself to be a versatile actor with a lot of range This performance must be seen

review_title: Great theme, bad ending for Tom.
review_comment: It is a great movie Much of my feelings have been shared already so won t repeat It is however very unfortunate that the shadows of the Sun at the end don t reflect what the the body language seems to indicate One is given the impression that Tom will be reaching out to the stain glass artist but the shadow of the sun is Casted over Tom s right side of the face In the previous footage when the car stops at the crossroads it is facing South according to her indications of the roads later on and the sun casts the shadows on the right side of the car It seems like it will be around 9 30 AM in a Texas morning but then when he decides where to go his face is logically looking South Therefore he is not going North emptiness all the whole length to Canada Is this an error in the movie or is it intentional meaning he loves Kelly so much that he is going South no matter what Have a good Trip to Mexico Tom and hey try to make sure you will be able to come back once the WALL is built Well that is a different story all together

review_title: So many people missed the point of this film
review_comment: I ve seen Cast Away nine times and I m still noticing bits of new information here and there Some of the people who missed the point of this film did so because they have basic details wrong I wish I had the space to write an in depth review but instead I ll just concentrate on one specific area of contention the ending and add my general opinion as to why this movie has been so widely misunderstood and misinterpreted SPOILER ALERT READ ON ONLY IF YOU HAVE SEEN THE FILM First of all Noland is not smiling at the end of the picture although he may be intentionally mimicking Wilson s half smile He is clearly facing in Bettina s direction but it is not clear that he is going to follow her The point is that he knows that he could follow her if he wanted to he is back to the place where he has choices about life again In the ice in my glass speech he says his low point on the island is about having power over nothing At the end of the film he has regained that personal power to go in whatever direction he chooses to follow Bettina or not The mere opportunity to make the decision is the resolution more important than the specific decision itself That is a psychologically sophisticated ending much more satisfying than the typical Hollywood alternative If he had jumped in the truck and driven after her I would have thrown something at the screen it just wouldn t have fit Also although he thought that Kelly was the woman with him on the island giving him the strength to go on during the four isolated years it is equally true that Bettina was with him on the island she was present with him through her art and his reproductions of her art even though he had never met her Bettina is a good match for Chuck for whatever reason she s grown comfortable with being isolated from modern life too she s living out in the middle of nowhere she s driving an antique truck in a culture that judges you by the trendiness of the car you drive she does not recognize him even though he s an international media celebrity the story of his rescue was thoroughly covered in all those newspapers and magazines on Kelly s dining room table Noland thought Kelly was his reason for living and he lost her but Bettina was his reason for living too in some ways more directly responsible for his survival and salvation escape and there is still a chance that he could have her a fairly good chance from the way she flirted with him and just wait till she hears the story about how her art saved his life I could go on and that s about the ending alone I think that the real problem with people s mixed response to this picture is that you do have to care about Tom Hanks to appreciate this performance I think he is a great actor and more than just a movie star but who says that the two can t be one and the same I care about every character he plays well we won t mention Sherman McCoy and the whole point of my moviegoing is to enter into a story about characters I can care about But that is a sign of my age and my identity as a student of human nature Most of us reading this board know that the modern movie going audience isn t interested in caring about characters anymore They don t care about Hanks Noland any other character or maybe even themselves for that matter In fact watching bad things happen to characters no one cares about drives most movies these days The vast majority of commercial hits are made for people who can only be entertained by laughing at people doing stupid things for the price of a movie ticket they get a chance to feel superior to somebody laughing at people being killed maimed or otherwise physically harmed how sick is that pat sentimental mush at the level of romance novels or true confession magazines stuff blowing up sexual display and innuendo How could those people hope to get anything out of Cast Away or any other serious picture They have no frame of reference no experience of reflecting on the meaning of life The other group of people who hate this film are the too cool for film school cynics who use their art as a distancing tool to keep from feeling uncool emotions like empathy tenderness and transcendence I don t even have space to go into how much I pity those people for they also have trouble entering into the real meaning of life and their art is therefore destined to be empty only appealing to others who have adopted the same cynical worldview I do love Tom Hanks I ll admit that I adore him admire him and respect him I love his intelligence his discipline his integrity his dedication to his craft his interest in history his liberal politics his happy marriage no small feat in this world and the fact that he shares my vocation as a student of human nature Also he is lovely to look at even with a Buddha belly a scraggly beard or wild man s hair those lips those eyes and he plays the full range of his expressive speaking voice like Yo Yo Ma on the cello Some of his critics think that those of us who love him are reading into his work a subtlety of emotion that isn t really there and or overlooking his over the top moments because of personal devotion to him I only know that I feel bonded to all the people who reacted to the depth of his performance in the same way that I did Whether we react to him out of our feelings for him or out of his acting ability is almost irrelevant how can who he is be separated from the art he creates This is what it means to be an icon a national treasure and all the other superlatives we use to describe him His own self is the only canvas on which any actor can paint he uses his personality his access to his own emotional history even the aura of decency that keeps us from accepting him as a bad guy he uses all of this to create these unforgettable roles and in return we care about the characters he portrays and the stories he tells In my opinion he should have about five Oscars by now look at Apollo 13 again look at Saving Private Ryan imagine them without Hanks imagine any other actor who ever lived trying to do what he did in Cast Away how many people would pay to watch Russell Crowe rub two sticks together especially if he were robbed of the superficial elements of his physical attractiveness As some other reviewer said it shouldn t matter how many Oscars you already have if you give the best performance of the year most physically challenging most emotionally authentic most essential to the artistic success of your film you ought to be the winner Hanks can easily do without that third Oscar for now But one of these days he will get it and with it the proof that he is the finest actor of my lifetime Let Russell have his make up Oscar Tom was robbed as surely as Ralph Fiennes was robbed for Schindler s List But in 25 years we ll still be watching Schindler s List and we ll still be watching Cast Away while The Fugitive will lie on some forgotten celluloid heap and Gladiator will have become as laughable as the Ten Commandments So although I m disappointed I can wait because Hanks will be turning in fine nuanced performances and making memorable emotionally resonant films for another 20 years long after Crowe has been supplanted by the next alpha male on the block Unsolicited advice for Russell Crowe get over yourself put your Oscar in a box send it to Tom Hanks and shut up And anyone who thinks Gladiator was a great film needs to arrange an immediate screening of Spartacus I ll stop short of saying that Cast Away is a great film like many others on this board I think I could have made or edited a better movie both a tighter movie with respect to the set up and a more complete movie with an expanded development of his descent into despair and resignation on the island It s too obvious that they shot a lot of other island footage that is left out but I guess Zemekis was right to be concerned about length since people have been complaining about that as for me it was 2 23 well spent and I dream of a three hour director s cut I would have also made the ending longer expanding the resolution between Noland and Frears But while Cast Away may not be a brilliant picture Tom Hanks definitely gives a brilliant performance It is the kind of acting that makes people think re evaluate come to a new understanding of the world It is the kind of performance that changes people s lives It changed mine I am still stunned that Hanks was overlooked on Oscar night I heard the Best Actor race was tight and the voting very close I guess too many of the Academy voters fit my description above cluelessly shallow or smugly cynical The rest of us love Hanks love his acting and loved Cast Away I think I ll go see it again tomorrow

Let me first say that I am a huge Tom Hanks fan and see most of his films I LOVED Cast Away and it s one of my favorites The photography and story and most of all Mr Hank s performance make this an outstanding film For an actor to play scenes with only himself and Wilson is just great Robert Zemeckis is an incredible filmmaker and I just loved this

Oh boy are survivor fans happy Whoever came up with the idea of making this movie hit the target The portrail of a Russian FedEx facility is rather funny yet amazingly idiotic Shnella Shnella my workers hurry up in german But anyways who cares see the movie for yourself it s a lot better than reading someone s comment By the way DVD will include footage of the rescue of the volleyball that was used in the movie Apparently it wondered off in the ocean and has been spotted by the Coast Guard and successfuly rescued Have fun watching that on DVD

I love Tom Hanks and his performance in this epic movie has made me love his acting even more I saw this movie in the theater 3 times and can t wait to own it I didn t like the ending much though but there s nothing I can do about that The acting and emotion put into this movie definitely make it one to remember

When I viewed this movie it was so excruciating to view the movie for the second time Tom Hanks gave a sterling performance that won a million hearts He had reached to the heart of the masses that is the beauty of his histrionics We know that pain has no language therefore it cannot be expressed but Tom Hanks gave a terminology to his pain without uttering a word in it His countenance spoke even the words of his heart He had really left an indelible mark in us no doubt in it The director really had an audacity to handle this delicate subject and the ending was too hard to bear In every moment of the movie we were able to feel Tom Hanks emotions which is so captivating I always wondered what Love is I was told that love is sharing caring and sacrifice which I always accepted but after viewing this movie I understood that love is a journey not a destination with needs lot of faith and endurance Tom Hanks may have not won his third Academy award but he deserves a standing ovation which merits every one s approbation

review_title: I loved this movie! If you have an open mind and a couple hours I think it's a must see.
review_comment: I went into this movie not knowing what to expect I had actually read a bad review and wasn t planning to see it at all Maybe the bad review is what set me up to be pleasantly surprised I can probably name on less than ten fingers the movies I actually wanted to see more than once when I first viewed them This is the third movie I ever rented and then immediately rewound and watched again I thought it was that good I had to have more And by the third time I was anticipating the dialog and I really got a kick out of it About the ending I thought it was perfect Some might think it falls short but I love to see things that are open to possibilities I feel this is a must see for anyone who enjoys a diversion I certainly do feel the need to get away from time to time And after what this guy goes through the line at the market definitely doesn t seem so bad

review_title: This movie sucked and is one long commerical
review_comment: Boring movie is one long advert for Wilson tennis products and Fed Ex I hate this movie it is overrated and sucks

Initially I thought a film almost entirely acted out by one person would be boring I was wrong On top of Hanks now regular encapsulating performance the direction is perfect even managing to make a scene where Hanks tries to start a fire by rubbing sticks together enthralling His gradual slip into insanity matched by his friendship with a volleyball is not only believable but also touching The fantastic photography and the Directors awareness to overlook the tempting schmalz of a typically American ending are the finishing points which create an overall perfect film which will no doubt go down as a modern day classic and deservedly so And now I m off to get a cherry coke

SPOILERS AHEAD A movie that takes itself way too seriously A grown man that cries when his beloved volley ball is taken away Aaaugh When not in desperate need of comic relief the running FedEx theme of I must deliver this unopened package cause cause I am loyal employee makes you want to gag What would have made this movie worthwhile is having the Tom Hanks character watch that rancher lady open up her package and it being a new HAM radio she ordered over the internet With now defunct batteries
Its good movie and has good story and has good actor

This movie portrays the typical stranded on a deserted island storyline I give this movie credit for the following reasons 1 Realism while no movie can truly portray an accurate depiction of real life this movie makes an honorable attempt A truly believable story overall but believable in the same way that The Old Man and the Sea is believable it is so dull that it might actually happen 2 Creativity I give this movie a higher rating because of the writers producers creativity in making everyone s favorite piece of sporting equipment Mr Wilson an integral part of the plot Unlike the Old Man and the Sea I mentioned earlier the leather bound counterpart to the protagonist works much more effectively than a large decaying fish While the fish is treated more as an object to be worshiped the volleyball is treated more as a companion and makes for much better dialouge Overall a good movie Very respectable performance by Tom Hanks who incidentally lost a decent amount of weight for his part Also this movie is yet another example of his ever expanding variety of roles and how his characters continue to evolve and mature

review_title: He missed the simplist way of making a fire.
review_comment: I found Cast Away enjoyable and thought provoking But it bothered me that this intelligent and resourceful man missed a simple way to make a fire He had a flashlight a Maglite which provided short lived protection from darkness with its symbolic security of civilization Eventually the batteries die and has to work very hard making a fire to feel civilized again But if he had removed the front of the flashlight he could have used it as a lens to concentrate the sun s light and easily have made a flame The glass cover to his pocket watch and the wrist watch could probably also have served Since their curves are not as great as the flashlight it would have taken a little longer

Warning spoilers below I was very pleasantly surprised by this movie though admittedly my expectations may have been fairly low Nonetheless I felt that the movie was deeper and more meaningful than the typical Hollywood fare while being plenty entertaining giving audiences a chance to get a good look at Tom Hanks at his best I was expecting a re hash of Survivor modus such as a bunch of shots of Tom Hanks eating bugs followed by a smarmy reunion with his cute blonde wife in a neatly contrived finale at the end Instead I was surprised by the complex themes examining the contrast between typical modern life of abundance and a scant life spent in solitude The pace of the movie was slow and contemplative especially by Hollywood standards without being boring This sparse set gave Hanks room to give a very personal and entertaining performance and gave audiences time to digest the deceptively complex themes The ending was satisfyingly uncompromising The opening scenes show Chuck Hanks character enforcing somewhat exaggerated yet realistic capitalistic regimens on simpler foreign cultures by training them to sort FedEx packages and measuring their competence down to the second But before long Chuck finds himself stranded on a small island with nothing to do where the smallest unit of time is a day During what becomes a multi year period of isolation Chuck and the audience are able to reflect on what is simplest and most important in life And Chuck learns the important lesson that life is so precious that it is probably worth living even if it seems unlivable and that anything can happen both good and bad Chuck s eventual personal transition that leads to his return to the modern world is reminiscent of Buddhism s Concept of Emptiness wherein you must truly have nothing before you can gain enlightenment Chuck s perspective on the modern world after his ordeal should cause the audience to reflect upon their own position in the same world and ask themselves how they would react if they lost things that they currently deem essential

This would have to be one of the best Tom Hanks movies I ve seen He was amazing I loved it when he talked to the volley ball it was hilarious I found this movie to be funny sad and moving If you have not seen Cast Away yet then you should go see it

Ok guys Even though T H is a reasonably good actor this movie focussed too much on him and his stupid ball and made the whole thing pretty one sided And it lasted 2 1 2 hours and the most exciting thing was when the ball fell in the water and TH had to save it Grasping for friends a bit too much And Fedex To summarise main characters Tom Hanks his ball and lots of Fedex packages Enough said A Big Fat 5 5 10

SPOILERS SPOILERS Spoilers ahead Personally I don t get all the negativity surrounding this film I think its mostly an anti Hanks contingent Hanks is quite simply one of the greatest actors out there No this is not his greatest film but I still put it in a category of being a great film The Fed Ex thing is a little annoying but its better to use a real company rather than Ye olde delivery service to bring some realism to the movie I ve only ever seen the movie in Japan so I ve always seen it with Japanese subtitles and the fact that there are no subtitles appearing on screen for long periods of time give testimony to how powerful the movie is despite no real dialogue for about a quarter of the movie Chuck Noland goes through a real transformation during his time away We see him at the beginning being a company man who can t relate to his colleague on a personal level and who brings a beeper to Christmas dinner By the end he totally opens up to his colleague and looks willing to settle into rural life with the woman at the end He is also willing to give up the woman he loves the old Chuck wouldn t have done that There is no way that this movie is about how shallow women are as one reviewer said I admit that 4 years is a little soon to fall in love remarry and have a child but anyone who has lost someone they loved would probably support her for doing this The last scene is very strong Chuck only had one road ahead of him at the beginning but now he has a choice I think most of us would like to be him standing at that intersection having a choice And to those who felt Wilson had more character than Chuck really just don t get it so its not worth informing you of the significance of that Simply put a great film that really shows us what a materialistic world we have become and shows us what can happen when we are given a choice in life Highly recommended For the record it is not 3 hours long as most people have stated
I am just gonna say one thing WWpWIIIIIIIILLLSSSSOONNNN Tom Hanks is one of the best Just go and see it you won t be disappointed

A lot of people don t understand the ending They think it a sad one but it s actually a very happy one Chuck is at the crossroad deciding where he should head The angel girl pulls up and they talk They are noticeably attracted to each other She leaves and he notices the angel wings on the back of her truck and he ponders He walks out unto the crossroad facing one direction then turns to the other direction and then the other and then he turns in the direction from which she came and the wind is blowing toward him Once again the tide came in and brought her to him as the tide brought him the sail He turns his head in her direction and a smile of realization comes to his face And they lived happily ever after and Kelly was jealous as all get out

I think that Cast Away is the best acting that i have ever seen Tom Hanks do i loved it It was a stretch from the norm and yet it was realistic to me as well although i wasn t too satisfied with Helen Hunt as his love interest i think that a better choice could have been made perhaps Meg Ryan they have always been the perfect fictional movie couple

This movie confused me quite a bit It wasn t boring like most people claim but you really don t want to watch this if you re feeling tired because you ll fall right asleep About half this movie is silence so you can easily add in your own voice until someone throws popcorn at your head There is some blood and they weren t kidding when they said disturbing images spoiler like when Chuck yanks out his own tooth with an ice skate If you know the Lord of the Rings movies you will be thinking ALOT about Gollum as Chuck has been trapped on the island for over four years and begins to talk to a blood covered volleyball named Wilson Yeah The ball has a name All in all a good story line a bit of a snooze but not bad Not something you d want your nine year old cousin to see but it isn t horrible If you re a Tom Hanks fan you ll love the movie Otherwise these aren t the droids you re looking for Move along

Although the movie was excellent the trailer ruined the experience I actually thought about requesting a refund I m not going to give away any spoilers because I practice what I preach but the trailer gives away a major plot point It has to do with the amount of time Chuck is on the Island I m not the first one to complain You can read what Zemekis said about the trailer controversy on this site What the F does he care He still made his millions regardless These marketers who make the trailers should really think about their spineless decisions and catering to the status quo
