I watched the DVD which has been sitting around for years just so i would have something to do for a few hours but came out amazed Many people misunderstand the whole movie saying it didn t have enough action or the four years with Tom Hanks on the island was too long I myself think that the entire movie was well balanced and well done The movie showed extremely well how you would try to survive on an island by yourself It showed the challenge of hunting your food creating fire so you could cook you food and mainly STAYING SANE The one thing that kept Tom Hanks character sane or at least some what sane he does talk to a vollyball is Helen Hunt s character but we never really got to know her because later Hanks finds out when he gets back that being with her again is not possible Sort of ironic Many people thought the ending was horrible but i think it shows well the many choices that Hanks had to face By putting him in the middle of the intersection he must go one way and that direction may change his life The woman that came and told him what there was each direction was not a replacement for Helen Hunt but merely another choice and kind of a guide by telling him what each road lead to And anyways she is better looking if he does end up with her so good for him In conclusion this movie was very risky because of the lack of dialogue and action after all he is on an island for four years by himself but Tom Hanks was able the pull it off and give and excellent performance I could not have chosen a better movie to watch when i need something to do You can find this video for probably not that much money these days I recommend strongly

Cast Away shows that a person s life and dreams can all change in an instant Not only does Robert Zemeckis show the affects death has on close individuals but also he shows the affects it can have on the world or in this case a company Zemeckis portrays a message in this film that if a person does not keep up with the world the world will pass them up with out any thought Cast Away is a film which captures the audience with a story of love and nonstop adventure It puts the audience in a place which can only be imagined This is a very well acted film because even after having only one person on the screen for over an hour and still it has the attention of the viewers I enjoyed this film and would recommend it to anyone who is interested because even though it has heartbreak it leaves us with a chance of hope

Castaway was moving and powerful Although Hanks relationship with Helen Hunt should have been developed a little more as the relationship between those two was vital to the story and could have enhanced the empathy of the viewer for the situation he later finds himself in However Helen Hunt doesn t really turn in a spectacular performance here the only roll I really liked her in was in As Good As it Gets and it may be for the best that she doesn t get a tremendous amount of screen time even considering the length of the movie This film I think further cements Tom Hanks in the roll of the Jimmy Stewart of our time he is again cast in an everyman role in which he so excels The main character is an intelligent interesting straightforward good honest unassuming person that I found easy to like and to sympathize with This movie is not filled with fireworks and if you don t like movies that take their time and move at a steady pace rather than racing from crisis to crisis you might not be that enthused This really is more a drama than an action movie I do like movies that allow me to get to know the characters involved and I did quite enjoy it I have recommended it to friends

Pointless pap I was not interested in the main character I learned nothing about him apart from the fact that he was supposed to be a walking advert for Fedex efficiency Yawn Did he learn anything about himself through his ordeal No Was he changed by it No I ve given it 2 more stars than it deserves because Hanks and Zemeckis gave it their best shot Zemeckis deserves to work on better stuff than this

This was one of the most overrated movies ever how can anyone have enjoyed this is beyond me Sure Tom Hanks is a terrific actor but even he could not rescue this flick The scene which he was stranded was as exciting as a Tom Green movie long boring and made no sense I was hoping for one good note to end the movie on Well will he get the girl No too bad Well how about WHAT WAS IN THE DAMN PACKAGE THAT YOU KEPT FOR 4 YEARS That you had to deliver yourself What was so difficult about giving us an idea to it s contents Could the director at least given this a good ending Well there is hope about this movie there is not going to be a sequel Well if there is I don t think this person will be around He ll be too busy at the Mr T film festival

review_title: The metaphor's used in this movie are great for making you reflect!
review_comment: I love how this movie shows just how good we have it today We don t have to struggle for food beg for water or pray for fire I didn t want to miss anything in this movie because every moment of it was important They did a very good job of making you feel his loneliness and understand all the pain he went through One part of the ending i enjoyed was when he was at the crossroad trying to decide where to go It both showed that nothing in this life lasts forever his relationship with his wife and that you need to keep an eye out to make sure you take advantage of what the tide will bring The ending was very sad but also helps remind you of the important things in life that you have right now Very glad i watched this movie i learned some things from it

This has to be one of the best Tom Hanks films i have seen lots of preparation went into this movie the amount of weight he had to lose to portray the character in his final years of being marooned on that paradise island where most would Love to take there holidays Chuck Noland is the boss of a postal company in America who is total obsessed with time Till he nearly losses track of it When watching this movie you cannot help but put yourself right where he is when the plane crashed into the sea there was many parcels which arrived on the beach and none where any real use to him except the football whom became his best friend and companion through those bad and lonely times The bit where he caught his leg on a rock or was it coral in the sea just put the topping on how sick he felt You are left with the thought what use would my cell phone really be unless i had a satellite link up You will really enjoy this movie it is a must sea get it sea Dave

review_title: Chuck Noland, an employee for FedEx, is sent on a business trip that resulted in a plane crash
review_comment: Cast Away does an incredible job using cinematography to convey a message Film makers using extreme long shots to show distance and the enormity of the island Close shots are also used to make you feel secluded They are used to make you feel like there is nothing else around except for Chuck and you as you are watching it The directors did a create job with just casting one actor Tom Hanks and using him without dialogs to portray everything that was going on There were incredible aerial shots of Chuck standing on top of a large cliff that is over the island and ocean to show how massive that the island itself is and how high up that Chuck is Panning shots were also used very well to make a specific area of land or body of water to seem longer or bigger than it actually is Symbolism played a big role in Cast Away It created multiple ideas in an audience s mind of how the movie could go The use of natural lighting made the overall film quality better If you love wondrous slightly intense dramas then Cast Away is for you It does not keep you on the edge of your seat but it keeps your mind always thinking ahead about how this story could possibly end out If you enjoy just a little romance and not an extreme amount you would also enjoy this movie This movie is for all types of people It is not over dramatic and girl like It is for both guys and girls If you like feeling a part of a setting this movie will give you that exact feel If you love adventurous movie shots such as views from a top of cliffs and underwater then this is a movie you will come out of wanting to watch over and over

This movie contains lots of thrill and excitement It starts in a simple mode and then the movie goes to a different level and the events look so original that you will get surprised by some extraordinary moments Its really worth to spend your 2 n half hours on this movie because it has something to talk about The movie is giving a good message and is really an eye Opener The acting was superb and things were looking natural and these are the basic reason that people will like this movie Good use of the mind and the things Enjoyed it If you are looking for some decent thrill and excitement then go ahead and watch it

FedEx began to write a commercial heard they could get Tom Hanks and decided to make it into a feature film I for one am very tired of paying to sit and watch commercials It completely takes away from the movie going experience Boooo on commercialism greed A product shot here or there is okay but this was over board pun intended Otherwise good cinematography and Hanks is Hanks but he is now a commercial actor in my book

review_title: Less action than expected, but a great story...
review_comment: Cast Away is an interesting story that forces us to think There are many great shots and nicely crafted scenes in Cast Away but what I think distinguishes it from most movies today is its willingness to show us a story rather than tell us what we should think and feel Although I would have liked to hear more of Hanks own thought process we re forced to look inward and see how Hanks character parallels our life Following the movie we are forced to reflect how we would act if we were on the Island what we would do if our only true love was lost for years only to reappear and how relationships lived inside our heads are often perfect but rarely play out in reality These all happen here and Zemekis wisely enough doesn t show us how they should be resolved but simply what happens to Hanks character and how an everyday man copes with extraordinary circumstances both on and off a deserted island

review_title: Another good one from Hanks, Zemeckis.
review_comment: This is one of the best films in a year of mostly oscar unworthy productions Tom Hanks and Robert Zemeckis crank out another great movie worth seeing following the success of Forrest Gump several years ago Cast Away is a significant improvement over Zemeckis last creation What Lies Beneath and Hanks turns in a performance that could score him a third Oscar It was certainly a dramatic risk for Hanks who spends over an hour in the movie acting alone with no costars and no background music

I went to see the movie in hope that it would not be another Hollywood movie and I came out of the cinema with a good feeling a feeling like if you had been there with Tom Hanks I think maybe the strongest moment was when he lost Wilson his only friend in 5 years Robert Zemeicks have done it again like he did with Forrest Gump he made us one with the carracter and I have to mention Tom Hanks Exellent play Without him I don t think the film would have the extra spice it is like the role was made for him So I think that Tom Hanks is the strongest Oscar candidate right now I gave this film the film an 9 because it is one of the best film in many years

I went into this movie just so i would have something to do for a few hours but came out amazed Many people misunderstand the whole movie saying it didn t have enough action or the four years with Tom Hanks on the island was too long I myself think that the entire movie was well balanced and well done The movie showed extremely well how you would try to survive on an island by yourself It showed the challenge of hunting your food creating fire so you could cook you food and mainly STAYING SANE The one thing that kept Tom Hanks character sane or at least some what sane he does talk to a vollyball is Helen Hunt s character but we never really got to know her because later Hanks finds out when he gets back that being with her again is not possible Sort of ironic Many people thought the ending was horrible but i think it shows well the many choices that Hanks had to face By puting him in the middle of the intersection he must go one way and that direction may change his life The women that came and told him what there was each direction was not a replacement for Helen Hunt but merely another choice and kind of a guide by telling him what each road lead to In conclusion this movie was very risky because of the lack of dialogue and action after all he is on an island for four years by himself but Tom Hanks was able the pull it off and give and excellent performance I could not have chosen a better movie to watch when i need something to do I ll be sure to get this one on DVD when it comes out GO WATCH IT

I want Wilson to be nominated for Best Supporting actor A supporting actor is there to give depth and help reflect main actors and that is what Wilson does Also this is by far the best Hanks has done in a film In Philadelphia and Forrest Gump his characters did not have to change much in the way of personality but here wow

God did this movie suck Boring pointless the kind of movie you want to send back to the directors producers and actors and say try again I kept hoping he would bleed to death or drown and take your dam volleyball with you too loser but no it just keeps going and going I usually enjoy a movie that takes its time to tell a story but this movie takes its time and goes absolutely nowhere The last third had me screaming at the screen No no god let it end Dreadful piece of trash 0 out of 10 and thats being kind

review_title: Sun, sea, sand and solo acting !
review_comment: SPOILERS SPOILERS Its Saturday evening its windy wet and very cold so a trip to the cinema sounds like a good idea Arrived and looked at what was on although the choice would be limited to those that I hadn t seen and those that hadn t sold out There s What women want but thats a get in touch with your feminine side sort of film There s The Gift but seen the preview and probably the best bits of the film already then Hannibal say no more What s left Well there s Dude where s my coat I m leaving if you stopped watching the preview after 5 seconds what will that say about the actual film And finally an East Asian offering something along the lines of Crouching Dragon Spanking the Monkey Still hadn t decided but time running out and the other films had already started umm must make more of an effort to get to the cinema earlier next time Cast Away it is then not my first choice but what the hell Two hours later and what can I say but wow The first scene with the pep talk he is giving the FedEx employees in Russia is a bit too long as is the next quarter of an hour I know that they have to show what kind of person he is before he is set adrift on the island but they could have done that in a couple of dozen words an average guy with the average US waistline who likes his job although it means he has to spend time away from his girl Having said that the rest of the film is just brilliant The casting was inspired as Tom Hanks is totally amazing Solo acting is always difficult but he pulls it off so well that you start to feel the range of emotions he goes though Hopelessness as he realizes his situation pain you just KNOW those rocks were sharp despondency single mindedness as he sets about his escape and finally bewilderment and heartbreak as he arrives back home only to find his girlfriend has married I thought the final scene was great does he or does he not find love in the end I ll leave that to your imagination but if you were paying attention then as he is pacing around at the cross roads trying to describe where to go next you may have noticed that little sparkle in his eye as he looks again in the direction of the pickup truck moving away from him And finally don t you wish you could know what was in the package he left on her doorstep Would have been a bugger if it was a mobile phone or a set of steak knives

review_title: One of the best movies I have ever seen.
review_comment: Cast Away is one of the best movies I have ever seen by far the best with Tom Hanks It has a very touching story and when it is over You don t want it to be If you have not seen it you have to do so now it is a must The main character Chuck Noland must survive alone on a island after the FedEx airplane crashes into the sea Will he and Wilson survive See the movie and you will know

review_title: Could it really be Tom Hanks?
review_comment: Could this sad excuse for a movie really star Tom Hanks AND win awards I m confused The plane crash scene has some great special effects If I just gave away too much of the plot watch the trailer again but other than that this was a terrible movie Mr Hanks has been great in other roles but playing the part of a man on a deserted island for several years is not only unrealistic but just downright stupid This is a disturbing trend for movies if the only thing required to be nominated for lots of awards is a big name actor a camera and a volleyball what is the world coming to

This movie was fantastic Great special effects and each island scene couldn t have been better The plane crash scene was edge of your seat directing Bob Zemeckis can make a movie very well However you are left with a bittersweet taste at the end as to whether or not SPOILER HERE Chuck gets the girl or not Zemeckis kind of leaves the audience hanging here which provides you with a kind of Huh thought in your head as you walk out of the theater Many of Zemeckis films leave you with a lack of catharsis at the end of the film such as Back to the Future III Otherwise the film was excellent However the trailer is misleading and hints that Chuck and his girl live happily ever after Anyway you should see this movie and decide for yourself what you think happened Enjoy

review_title: One of The Best Movies and Script I´ve ever seen!!!
review_comment: At the beginning of the movie I thought the picture was just going to be another version of Daniel Defoe s book Robinson Crusoe but let me tell you that with Tom Hanks and Helen Hunt in the cast you can feel the movie When you see Tom Hanks trying to make fire you notice how we sometimes do not appreciate life as we should they have to take things away from us to really learn that we only live once Something amazing and that you will probably notice is how Tom Hanks really workout to be able to film the second part of the movie something similar when he did Philadelphia with Denzel Washington I truly recommend this movie when I was sitting at the theatre I wanted the story to never end maybe because I was wishing the end was different but I guess that s what makes this movie one of the best Rubens RAPL

this movie over all was pretty good when he s on the island though i kept getting scared that something was gonna pop out like a bat or something and the whole volly ball thing was kinda creepy but the ending was great and i wanted to know what was in the package sooo go see it and if you happen to figure it out email me have a nice day

review_title: What was in the Fedex box?
review_comment: Tom Hanks once again proves his superior acting abilities as he holds the audience s attention for the movies entire length From Moscow to the remote pacific island the audience was engulfed with truly powerful settings and human emotions The only question that was left in the audience s mind was What was in the Fedex box I believe that the ending would have been better served with a bit more finality However I feel it was a bit too open I would have liked more of a climatic ending But with that said my congratulations to Mr Hanks for another wonderful and refreshing movie going experience

review_title: A soggy Robinson Crusoe with a touch of Unrequited Love
review_comment: Perhaps it s a generational thing after all my moviegoing history dates to childhood in the 30s so my perspective may be a little warped But with all due respect to the talented Mr Hanks this is a Robinson Crusoe for the new century that just doesn t work High tech yes SFX yes But soggy soooo soggy And that dash of Unrequited Love is a tease that just doesn t work either even when it involves the talented Ms Hunt Too bad

First off I will agree with anyone who says the performance by Tom Hanks And most any other actor or actress in this movie was quite astounding However I feel this movie s problems are What Lies Beneath To steal the title from Zemeckis other film this year Usually I am the last person to say a movie is boring oftentimes my favorite movies are those with a 3 hour running time At times however this movie to be blunt is BORING The reason for this is because all the island scenes are strung together one after another if the movie were to show one or two island scenes and then a scene of what was going on back home Say his friends and families reactions to the crash or his funeral and so on the pacing wouldn t have suffered so greatly Second on this island he has food water shelter and so on So why is he unhappy Easy No human contact This is where Wilson the volleyball s role was so pivotal Yet everyone in the auditorium including myself could not stop laughing The movie failed on all counts to show Mr Hanks character s grief I kept drawing parallels between the last 45 minutes of this film and David Croenberg s The Dead Zone Both feature a character who has been removed from society for a number of years and then is thrown back in only to find that everything has changed The movie could ve succeeded here It could ve shown in detail what had changed it could ve further allowed Tom Hanks and Helen Hunt to show off their acting chops it could ve shown how the characters dealt with these changes it could ve been a better movie In 1998 s The Thin Red Line Terrence Malick proved to be quite a visionary director by showing silence and serenity and how it can get to a person This probably would ve made him the better director for Cast Away Alas we ll never know All in all this isn t a bad movie so much as it is a disappointment It s nice that Tom Hanks and Robert Zemeckis can make exceptionally good movies it s just a shame this isn t one of them

I am sorry to say especially with all the hype thrown at this film that I did not like this film Mainly the problem is the film tried to go somewhere but left me hanging on where Most of the actions Hanks takes on the island the film doesnt fill us in on what he is trying to accomplish and by the time you figure it out he is on to his next action At the beginning they could have had him talk to himself filling us in on what he s trying to do It does get a little better when he talks to Wilson They just didn t fill in enough for the viewer they left too much up to the viewer to figure out And the ending once again just leaves the viewer in the middle of nowhere trying to figure it out All in all disappointing

I love this movie It was wierd at the beginning it seemed like a different story It was suspenceful funny sad and adventureous Even though there were only two main characters Tom Hanks and Wilson it stayed interesting and funny I will definitely add this to my movie collection

If this film will receive the Oscar prize I ll be very disappointed Of course this film is not bad but it s not genial at all One interesting thing is that it is quite sad so this is original In one word if you don t have anything to watch you can go to see it but if you have something more interesting that going to the cinema don t hesitate anymore choose the other thing

review_title: This movie was not as good as it could have been . . .
review_comment: I went into Cast Away with expectations I would see a decent movie And I did But I did not see a great movie I am a big fan of Hanks Hunt Zemeckis and Broyles and they all could have done more Hanks and Hunt did as well as they could with below average scripting and direction I was disappointed the movie did not really deal with Hanks mental strain and scarring that no doubt would accompany living alone for 1500 days talking to a volleyball and I was also disappointed with the movie s nonchalance of simply reinserting Hanks back into society after his 1500 days alone I think there were some psychological gems missing in the movie that would have made it great Also Hunt s southern belle accent fades in and out from scene to scene annoying

I was entertained by this movie Tom Hanks was able to hold my interest through his 50 minute monologue The crash scene had me in as much of a fetal position as I could muster in my seat I do not believe that this is Oscar material though as compared to some of Hanks previous works It is no Philadelphia or Forrest Gump

I absolutely loved this movie It spans the universe of human emotions from love to despair then determination hope perseverance a movie where you can laugh and you can cry Beautifully directed and with a terrific score that gives a unique poignancy to scenes depicting the most extreme of human emotions this movie proves that you don t have to have non stop action to create a beautiful moving film rather unique in today s film industry Anyone who is not moved emotionally while following the travails of Tom Hanks characterization of Chuck Noland in this movie should have his heartbeat checked Tom Hanks has given us many wonderful performances but this one is his best

Very good film and very surprising that Hollywood chose to challenge the viewer so much This is definitely a film that makes you think it sure doesn t present everything up front for the lowest common denominator movie goer as most films do I was amazed in reading the comments on this Db that nobody pointed out how much Hanks character s experience on the island mirrored the centuries of experience of ancient man in the Pacific The learning to create fire the way to get fresh water eventual speech notice how long on the island Hanks doesn t speak only when some of his most basic needs have been met does he move up Maslow s hierarchy and the creation of his own idol god in Wilson His own life depending upon fate and the whim of the tides The story is that of the evolution of man Moreover take his time on the island and compare it to what he had before he got on that plane Juxtapose the two and I think the movie makes a strong comment on how far we ve come standing on the shoulders of millions of years of evolution We ve forgotten how we got here and the movie attempts to remind us We re so far into self actualization that we d all be lost if all our stuff was taken away The love story that continues long after the film ends which is left up to us to create could be the greatest present this film offers Helen Hunt s character isn t developed because the viewer isn t supposed to grow too attached to her We are meant to dwell on what may be down the road for Hanks and White All that and the commentary on God or fate whatever you believe versus random occurrence Is there any measure of control exerted by us in our own lives is there a guiding force or is it all the natural whim of the universe This movie really let s you begin to ponder all of this but doesn t force you to think just one way I like movies like that

review_title: Longer than it has to be
review_comment: This movie is great in almost every aspect starting from the courage to make such movie with a significant risk if that it might fail it s such an authentic experience and the fact that they didn t have to do any of the crazy stuff like Wild animals of any sort sharks snakes or whatever comes in mind and they just proved that surviving the thirst and hunger alone is tough enough but the main problem here that really drove me off that this movie is way longer that it s supposed to be they could ve cut 30 mins of unnecessary extended scenes at some point while this movie is still great it got me to sleep in a few scenes due to the nothingness

review_title: Thoughtful, brilliant, and original film--a must-see
review_comment: I saw the Austin premiere of Cast Away yesterday and have been haunted by it since It is a profoundly moving film about one ordinary man s struggle for survival not just of the body but of the heart and mind at the hands of an indifferent Fate It is alternately funny unnerving gruesome beautiful and poignant and at all times believable I cannot recall another picture from a major studio this spare in terms of script and style it is a daring and refreshing movie Tom Hanks as Chuck makes the story compelling carrying more than an hour of the picture by himself with little dialogue and no soundtrack besides wind waves and rain The film can be enjoyed purely for the entertainment value of watching Chuck become lost and find his back to civilisation no spoilers here folks or it can be explored for many layers of meaning about relationships about destiny about ingenuity about inspiration and about our basic humanity The movie is not heavy handed with its message you take from it what you put into it and the audience is expected to work at it a bit Even the title is multi faceted but don t be daunted See this movie see it many times as I plan to do

If the makers of Castaway were trying to convey how boring it is to be stranded on a deserted island they did a fabulous job The pace of this movie is mind numbingly slow and the characters were undeveloped All we learn about the protagonist in the beginning which is just one long Fed Ex plug is that he s obsessed with his job and time more time was spent developing his relationship with a volleyball than the love of his life Helen Hunt

review_title: It's not a movie about merely surviving, but really living.
review_comment: This movie isn t called Castaway as in someone who s lost on a desert isle it s Cast Away as in something that has been discarded with time Chuck Noland never wanted to commit the sin of turning his back on time when in fact time turns its back on him This isn t a movie about merely surviving a four year imprisonment on a deserted island but about whether that survival is worth it It doesn t take long for Chuck to figure out if he can survive or not but it takes him the entire four years to decide that that is not enough Chuck Noland s life is taken away from him twice Both times he has to rebuild and discover a new reason to live He learns through these ordeals that it is alright to turn your back on time but to never let the moment pass you by

Having expected a great movie i went to the theatre and what i saw was an average movie Not more Thre was a plot which did never reflect a conflict it touches Neither the problems of a man who has to cope alone on a lonely island nor the conflict of a woman who has to decide between two men This movie does nothing of all It shows for about 150 minutes a story with time lapses that avoid to feel really into the problems of its protagonists or even to feel into one aspect of these problems What does the movie want to be A adventuere film of a new Robinson Crusoe or a movie about inter human conflicts It seems to me that the movie can t decide between both wants to be everything and therefore is nothing of both So really Whats so great about it Average

review_title: There is NO such company as FedEx in Russia
review_comment: Nice movie but the whole part about the Russian FedEx brunch in Russia is a total bummer There is no such company here FedEx is totally useless in Moscow and other parts of Russia So there is just a nice story about NO existing FedEx and there dreams to be worldwide But Tom Hanks is surely cool Nice story about a nice guy who brought some present from snowy Russia Finally the true part is that FedEx never cared about its employees and clients FedEx would dream about being in Russia but the only company really works worldwide is DHL That s the best courier service much better than FedEx Some day FedEx decide to lie about it s services and they failed even here

I really enjoyed this movie It didn t have the best dialogue well of course not He was stranded alone on an island and it didn t go into some aspects that I would have liked for it to have gone into but it was definately captivating It is one of those movies that you would be willing to postpone going to the restroom just so you can see what s going to happen next I would give it a strong 8 on a 10 pooint scale My wife gives it an 8 5

This movie scared the hell out of me If it were me on that island I wouldn t have made it four weeks let alone four years All of it is just crazy to think about and doesn t do much for my fear of flying either I don t fancy myself a critic so I ll put it all in one sentence If you feel bad about your life go see this movie because maybe you ll change your mind

I was looking forward to an inspiring plot and a unique role for Hanks but this movie was disappointing Though the film was over two hours in length I couldn t help but feel that a lot of content had fallen gracelessly to the cutting room floor Time as a concept seemed to flip flop senselessly particularly when Hanks first few compelling and frightening weeks on the island abruptly end and we are informed with an awkward subtext that four years has transpired leaving Hanks lean mean and slightly demented Some scenes with his co star Wilson were touching Others were contrived And Hanks pathetic throaty cries as Wilson metaphorically drifts away reminded me more of his character in The Money Pit than anything else It was hard to take him seriously And I won t even mention the silliness of Hanks cetacean buddy who seemed to magically appear when he was needed most Finally there is Helen Hunt who seems to be the flavor of the moment in Hollywood but in this film she is poorly cast Her performance lacked the true grief desperation and elation her character should have demonstrated Overall this movie was disappointing I expected a more riveting performance from Hanks but the film s editors and writers should accept a greater share of blame for the oft contrived shallowness of what should have been the best film of the year See it but wait for the video

My favourite Zemeckis films have always been Contact and Forrest Gump Now his new film Cast Away is added to that list Cast Away is the ultimate Man vs Nature epic This films starts off with Chuck Noland Hanks a Fed Ex executive who takes his job very seriously in Moscow pushing everybody to make their deliveries on time you find out alot about his character in the way he handles his job He is a person who always has to be on time When he returns home to Memphis you meet Kelly Frears Hunt who is Noland s girlfriend During a dinner party with family and friends Noland is unexpectedly paged and has to go to somewhere off the east coast of asia to deliver some mail Hanks and Hunt quickly exchange christmas gifts in the car on the way to the airport During the very realistic and intense airplane crash into the Pacific Ocean Hanks finds himself stranded on a uninhabited island The movie takes a daring turn here The film becomes a one man show as Hanks finds himself stranded This could make or break the movie for you Hanks now does what he does best to make this a very entertaining one man show During his stay on this island you will laugh cry and most importantly think about what is in store for this very entertaining character The comic relief comes from a volleyball named Wilson with a face painted on it with Hank s blood Cast Away is really everything the summers blockbuster The Perfect Storm was not I didnt really feel for the characters in perfect storm Hanks pulls off the role of Chuck Noland magnificently The cinematography make you feel like you are with Hanks on the island And best of all Robert Zemeckis s directs this film with so much genius and poise he becomes one of the best at what he does again

This movie had the potential to be truly great A great cast great special effects and an original plot were all in place Unfortunatley the execution and the details were poor and it seemed as if the script was written in a rush without any thought Tom Hanks character finds himself on a deserted island after a plane crash From then on he acts as a man with no brain Upon finding numerous FedEx packages washed up on shore he stacks them up and opens them days later including one that he NEVER opens Upon finding a flashlight he sets it down while on and promptly falls asleep letting the batteries burn out Left with a small rubber raft he takes it out into the obviously huge waves puctures the raft and his leg in the process He does manage to produce fire but is then seen four years later eating raw fish I guess the fire thing got old huh After being on the island FOUR YEARS he gets the idea to BUILD A BOAT Only four years to think of that Intertwined in all this is an ongoing conversation with a freaking VOLLEYBALL He finally builds the boat and gets out into the open sea He loses the volleyball and weeps uncontrollably and then decides to throw away his oars and lay there and give up Funny how the volleyball is everything but those oars don t mean a whole lot Miraculously he is found and the movie grinds to an end By the end I was so frustrated I wished he had died

this is a great movie the best in a long time ready for an experience that you only have once in a long while at the movie theatre go see Cast Away The collaboration of both Tom Hanks and Robert Zemeckis together again is wonderful and enchanting with the flavour of humour that these two bring to the screen makes be wonder why this is only the second movie together get out and see it will yah

An honest journey into a man s fight for survival demonstrating how life without the material world is barely even life for modern day civilisation Examining solitude in a way perhaps never before explored in such a popular medium Over an hour of the movie is speech free putting focus on to both Tom Hanks and Robert Zemekis to deliver and they really do deliver The 5 I was less than impressed with constituted the ending shallow rushed and unlikely potential spoiler below Four years in desperate solitude would have changed his personality dramatically and that provided a great opportunity for a consistently excellent ending yet the final cut of the ending doesn t quite deliver You re left thinking that the ending belonged to an entirely different movie The beginning and middle section however are easily worthy of oscars and worth many times the money spent at the theatre

review_title: Interesting, but there could have been more
review_comment: With a great actor in Tom Hanks and a good story line I was a bit disappointed that there wasn t more substance in this movie There were many opportunities to further develop the story after his return Don t get me wrong because this was still a highly entertaining movie

review_title: A Three-hour long Fed Ex commercial
review_comment: I don t remember being so bored from a movie The only good part in the movie I thought was the actually island but that was only like a quarter of the movie The other three quarters were brutally slow The lead up to Hanks getting on the island and after were so tiring to watch And if that wasn t enough we re forced to look at Fed Ex logos and packages throughout the whole movie

This is an interesting stimulating movie I don t think I would be spoiling any part of the plot by telling you that the middle third of the film should be titled Castaway Hanks character is stranded on a deserted isle and we experience his efforts to survive This portion of the film IS interesting but I thought it went on too long Now what follows may spoil the outcome something the trailers in uncharacteristic fashion have not The most intriguing portion of the film is the last third when Hanks character returns to modern society and then is forced to confront being cast away two words This is the portion of the film where we really begin to empathize with the main character Most of us have not had to face nature one on one but all of us have had to face some form of rejection or being cast away Zemekis could have made a truly Oscar caliber movie though I don t doubt that this will receive a nomination if he had focused on this all too human experience rather than the intricacies of raft construction

review_title: It's not so good that I was thinking!
review_comment: Effect of the movie was good the picture too The actors was really good It was funny too but I think that the end is bad sad I saw it tonight and I was disappointed

Everyone I saw this with our group and the rest of the theater was enthralled This isn t a movie that spoon feeds all its meaning to you you have to pay attention and think Hanks s does an amazing portrayal from shock to determination to escape to frustration desolation fear through despair a kind of reversion to primitive nature and bare grip on the edge of sanity from isolation The movie really explores issues of humanity community and human need without preaching it It s why I liked Saving Private Ryan better than The Thin Red Line Ryan had every bit as much to say about war and its effects but let you figure it out I would have to disagree with some comments such as that Hanks should have had time to enjoy the natural wonders not when mere survival is your full time every waking minute job and nature can easily be the enemy Also Hanks does explore as much as is physically possible you see everything he can see from that summit and there is only one beach I think the intensity comes from the whole movie except first few minutes being entirely from his vantage point I would not have wanted to see what was going on back home I also can t imagine why there ever would have been any other human on this volcanic outcropping hundreds of miles from nowhere so I m not sure what good a skeleton in the cave would have done SPOILER REBUTTAL AND COMMENT It was not the view of any in our group that he replaced Hunt with the redhead He was at the last looking down a different road the one toward California The ending didn t feel satisfying but I can t say it was unsatisfactory Hunt was ambivalent about commitment at the beginning and still ambivalent at the end She was consistent in that way Hanks was in a way still adrift only knowing that the sun will rise tomorrow

review_title: My spiritual connection with the movie, and my recommendations.
review_comment: I thought Cast away was an incredible movie The kind of movie that leaves you numb and motionless in your seat The team of Robert Zemeckis as director and Tom Hanks as star once again touched me in the same way that Forrest Gump with its epic style cinematography did before The story of a man who is cast away from a life of convenience to a life of extreme conditions that test his will to survive When I was watching the film I kept questioning myself questioning my capabilities if I were thrown into the same situation Would I fight to stay alive or just give up I certainly wouldn t have relied on a volleyball but it was a nice touch and this is a nice movie I ll give it 4 s a definate don t miss

When I first heard that Cast Away was about some guy who was stuck on an island for four years I thought Yah that s sounds REAL exciting sarcastic Then I started to think Well Tom hanks is in it how bad could it be So I went to see it and I was totally blown away You know you ve seen a great movie when you can t stop thinking about it for weeks after you ve left the theater I still get tears in my eyes thinking about Chuck s will to survive in Cast Away I can not even begin to fathom four years on an island ALONE I mean this guy s only companion for four whole years is a volleyball I think I d forget how to speak English after that long there but Chuck never loses his will to survive and makes do with what he has His memories of Kelly keep him alive and like he says afterward he just kept on breathing kept on living SPOILERS ALERT Three particularly striking moments in the movie were when he lost Wilson when he said that he had lost Kelly when the plane crashed then he had to lose her all over again when he was saved and third when he made fire HE felt like the greatest man alive and perhaps he was at the moment or for the next four years Chuck loved his volleyball it was his buddy he talked to it he argued with it discussed with it and then mourned over his losing it Although he seems to lose so much in the movie he has gained a much deeper understanding of himself and is in better touch with his soul and spirit He has endured just about as much as anyone can and lives though it The audience obviously finds itself wanting Chuck and Kelly to get back together and we weep with Chuck when we realize that it cannot happen Who else is still wondering what became of the Christmas present presumably an engagement ring that Chuck gave to Kelly the last time he saw her just before he got on the plane I think that his time on the island could have been a little more drawn out and his relationship with Kelly more developed but all in all this was one of the most touching films I have ever seen Forrest Gump is first on that list I have so much admiration for Tom Hanks You not only leave his movies thinking for weeks about the plot but thinking about his characters admiring them dreaming about them relating to them loving them I would so much love to be an actress like that and I have yet to find a female actor that I can look up to in that way Acting is what I love to do most and I will strive to do it in the fashion that Tom Hanks does If I ever make it to the big screen even for a second I pray that it is beside Tom Hanks THANK YOU TOM HANKS

review_title: One of the best thought provoking movies I have seen!!
review_comment: It was without a doubt one of the best I have seen in a long time It sure is a good idea that maybe Hollywood continue making real human stories So sick and tired of violence and dumb space and other stupid plots Never visited this site before and not sure why I have to fill in four lines to say a movie is great but here they are 5 lines

review_title: A single man trapped on a Island where his adventure begins
review_comment: A SUPERBLY AMAZING FILM Extrodinairely breath taking you can t take your eyes off this movie even if you tried it s that FANTASTIQUE With it s mix of eye popping scenes and unbelivable performance by the very gifted Tom Hanks this movie will rank in my top ten for a very long time

review_title: Slightly shallow, but a good ride.
review_comment: This is a GREAT film Being that the majority of films of 2000 were not that great this is a shoe in for multiple Oscar nominations Tom Hanks gives a great performance really making us feel as though we re there with him as though our fates are entwined with his His ability for acting shines in this role The greater part of the movie rests in mostly silence as we watch Hanks character Chuck struggling to live on the tiny island which has become his prison What s interesting about this is that it rips away all the advances and advantages we as a human race have gained leaving Chuck to learn all over again how to survive Rarely have I been actually hurt when I ve seen a character on screen experience pain One scene in particular which makes the audience cry out is when Chuck loses Walter I doubt there was one person in the theater that wasn t hurt wasn t hoping against hope that Hanks would get him back and was almost in tears when he didn t Granted the plot of this film is not complex and does not require much thought but that s not a bad thing Tom Hanks acting ability turns what could have been a mediocre role into one of depth making the viewer sympathise with every hardship he must endure One thing I ve heard many times over is how bad the ending is Why Because it s not happily ever after It is NOT a warm and cozy ending it s not made to make us feel good inside It s realistic And to those who scoff and Hanks sadness you ve failed to really FEEL his character Put yourself in his shoes How would you feel Want a funny movie See Dude Where s My Car Want a movie with a happy ending See Gladiator Want an emotional movie to envelop you and truly tie your feelings into knots See this one You will not be disappointed

I thought this was a great film Tom Hanks was brilliant I liked the way the director brought in an element of comedy in a film which was really quite serious Before I saw the film I was told that it wasn t great but I always believe in giving films a chance and I m glad I did with this one The only fault I found with it was that the ending was a bit dragged out I would definitely recommend this film to anyone who doesn t mind sitting for 2hrs 20mins

review_title: It only seemed like four years.
review_comment: Tom Hanks is a consummate professional who will go to whatever extreme necessary to be his character His only flaw in this film is picking the script Is it possible to sustain audience involvement for 60 minutes of one person on a deserted island no people no animals not even snakes lizards and bugs Four years is a long time to watch a movie

review_title: I loved it ,I was a little disappointed on how it ended
review_comment: I liked it it was very good It showed you never know when something can happen and totally change your life Tom Hanks did a super job I was a little disappointed on how it ended however it was a good movie and I would absolutely recommend it

I don t know if he gets the girl or not at the end but contrary to someone else s earlier posting Hanks most certainly at least pursues the opportunity with Lari White character at the end The earlier poster wrote He was at the last looking down a different road the one toward California SPOILER ALERT That is incorrect Hanks stepped out from his jeep into the middle of the intersection He looked forward then to the left and right and finally turned back around and faced up in the direction of his jeep which is the direction toward the woman s ranch His hint of a smile combined with other factors mentioned by other commenters clearly implies that Hanks goes back to pursue this new opportunity When you couple that with the last words of the previous scene where Hanks talks about how his will to live changed with the port a potty shell which washed up on the beach and that life is about seeing what washes up next it becomes clear to me that Lari White becomes Hanks s next opportunity which washes up on the beach As far as I m concerned this is a great ending I can t stand Helen Hunt and the only reason I was able to go see this otherwise outstanding film was the foreknowledge that Hunt occupies very few minutes on the screen

review_title: Left a bad taste in my mouth
review_comment: It would have been an ok I would have enjoyed it more had it not been for all that FedEx product placement It was by far the worst I have ever seen It made me so upset I almost left the theatre We shouldn t have to pay for a film with that much advertising Secondly the theatrical trailer showed the whole dang film beginning middle and unfortunately the end And my last bitter comment was the four years later that came up I felt robbed when that came on screen What happened I wanted to see his interaction once he is rescued Oh well guess it s not my movie

A remarkable film truly inspired and amazingly executed This is no teenager movie You have to be wise enough to appreciate life love and loss in short you must have LIVED to understand it Most of the viewing crowd young and old hasn t the wisdom and will not understand even 10 of this movie all they can get out of it is the superficial If you didn t understand The Green Mile in all of it s deliciously complicated splendor you will fail to undertstand Cast Away yes I mean Cast Away not Castaway But for those of you who have gone through the pain of IMMEASURABLE LOSS you WILL understand I said it s about divorce because that is the journey of loss I related to Some of the more obvious symbology that alludes to this thesis are the divorce certificate in the FedEx box his job leads to a divorce the dead pilot s family picture there is no wife in the photo the island represents his despair and loneliness at being cast away by his wife but at the same time the island is a sanctuary which allows him to experience and reveal his true self Further the island lonliness and separation feeds protects and cares for him over time so he can grow strong to meet the challenge of the waves change journey Finally the raft represents the promise of a new life the volleyball the old self the paddles represent letting go and accepting God Fate reality and the whale is the confidence that there is a spirit guide guardian angel watching over us all we have to do is listen The movie is beautifully made and has a beautiful message SURVIVING LOSS Whether that loss is the loss of a loved one because of divorce or through physical death this movie is about surviving the greatests depths of despair and surviving our inner psychological worlds not our physical worlds Those of you who have will know what I mean John

DANGER SPOILERS AHEAD It is well known that Tom Hanks took 6 months off to lose the weight needed to make the 4 years later transition One would think during that time somebody could have contemplated a better resolution Anybody Someone wrote here before me the lack of transition between the rescue and the return to the real world was a disappointment I agree There seems to be a hole in the story that is circumvented by 4 weeks later Those 4 weeks could have been alot more intriguing than the 3rd act we re given DANGER SPOILERS AHEAD For instance I wanted to see Hanks being rescued He wakes up to a ship and then he s on a plane 4 weeks later It would have been alot more interesting to explore his view from nothingness to everything during this time There would be press junkets and a book deal somewhere in the making Instead he returns to his job at Fed Ex and we get a tacked on ending to resolve a nowhere relationship It would have been more satisfying for Hanks to return to the Island possibly with the family of the Fed Ex worker he buried Zemeckis was overflowing with ideas for Forrest Gump Here it is like he runs out of gas Be forewarned if you are sensitive to a fidgety audience wait for the video There is about an hour of near silence that can be deafening in a theater I can t dismiss the film as a whole The plane crash is amazing and the central part of Hanks on the Island is the saving grace Very thought provoking What would you do if you just survived an impossible situation only to find that that was the easy part Great premise great acting poor follow thru Too bad somebody didn t step forward and go the final mile 7 out of 10

I have always loved Tom Hanks movies This is one movie that I was disappointed with There simply was not enough action in the movie to retain my interest and I caught myself dozing off a couple of times during the boring parts I felt this could have been a much better movie if there had been more action taking place while he was stranded on the island and it would have made the movie much more interesting

Tom Hanks carried this movie I am not going to give you the run down of the plot or the script lets just say that they re rather poor But the acting on all levels were I thought rather excellent There was about an hour and a half of no background music just Tom hanks acting So it was going it was going to be him that makes or breaks the movie and he succeeded

Not knowing if I could endure Tom Hanks on a desert island for an hour or so I decided to take the plunge and go see this movie and what a film Right from the start I was intrigued how the film was going to pan out waiting for that all exciting plane crash which I d heard so much about and boy how that didn t dissapoint It was terrifying So much so that I found myself willing it to crash to get it over with but for 10mins we were subjected to a horrifying rollercoaster of a flight with the end result seeming to take a lifetime to come and when it did it wasn t over In the sea with just a liferaft Hanks life was still in danger and when night finally turned into morning I breathed easy again The island was beautiful and this must have some of the best filming sequences I have ever seen in a movie Even though there is only one person on screen for the majority of the film and virtually no music I did not find myself for one minute being bored or losing my concentration it was fabulous but then things started to go wrong The screen went black for no reason and the words Four years later appeared on the screen what Just as we were settling in to see how he would cope we skipped forward four years and had to endure a bravado escape plot which quite frankly should have happened three years earlier Putting that aside though I went with the flow until he was found that is Ok we knew he would have to get back and he did but when he did and Helen Hunt decided not to take him back even without seeing him THAT S WHEN THE FILM SHOULD HAVE ENDED In the lounge of FedEx headquarters NOT half an hour later We had to endure an extra three or four tacky schmultzee scenes which had no place or need in this film and in my opinion turned this film from a superb piece of cinema history to a absolute sham and cop out Thank god though they didn t get back together in a tear jerking reunion Apart from all this though I m awarding this film 8 10 for sheer guts and innovation And no I do not think Tom Hanks deserves an oscar for this

I don t know what you ve heard but most of the critics are raving while many ordinary folks seem to be rather disappointed I read one review by a member of the public who was moaning about a poor script god only knows what he was expecting when it s a story about a guy stuck for years on his own on an island Anyway to state the obvious and provide some perspective this is not a special effects movie but the scenery is impressive and the cinematography is quite often excellent The script is of course thin but the small amount of character interaction is largely convincing and you can relate to the two main characters To sum up this movie is trying to make you think and sympathise if you just sit and stare at the screen with brain disengaged you will either fall asleep or just get incredibly bored The film wasn t exactly what i had expected but the more i thought about it afterwards the more i realised how good a film it was In terms of making you step back and assess your life this film is almost as good as It s a Wonderful Life it s just a shame that the effect wears off

review_title: cast away by Dadou and Thomas!
review_comment: We liked Cast Away because it s an adventure film Chuck Noland succeeded to change his way of life The story is interesting because we saw a man facing his loneliness Tom Hanks perfectly plays the part of the adventurer Some scenes are funny and others are a little disgusting He is so lonely that he speaks to Wilson a volleyball ball We loved the moment when he discovers fire We don t see time passing during the film We advise this film to those who like adventure films Nice Film

review_title: nothing more than a boring commercial
review_comment: Let me start with the positive stuff about this movie The music is like in Forrest Gump absolutely great and always fits to the scenes But that s about it The main bad thing is that this movie had the chance of being good But not one of the things that could have been interesting was brought up At first we have a guy who finds himself on an island But just after he finds out how to survive physically we read 4 years later as a subtitle His whole psychological development is presented with the fact that he talks to a volleyball named I won t take part in the product placement that p me off during the whole movie I mean we got a guy with no one to talk to 4 years with no courts or people judging his actions that s stuff you can make a great movie out of something which also challenges the actor instead of just having him lose 50 pounds Ok we will not see what he did during this 4 years the story carries on He now decides that 4 years are enough and that he wants to go back And then there s another situation that could have been interesting but he also finds back into real life after 4 days or a similar period I have no problem with his decision to go on with his life without his wife but his period of inner struggle is so short in this movie so that you can not appreciate his decission as much as it deserves Besides all this imagine the movie would have had all that stuff Could you the have enjoyed it Not me as long as half of the time I can always read Fed E on the screen This is something so sad as Tom Hanks should have enough money to act in movies with less product placement and a bigger stress on the story I guess I just expected way too much of a director actor couple that once made an awesome movie named Forrest Gump

I was fairly skeptical that a movie containing a lengthy portion about a guy by himself on an island could hold a viewer s interest But wow it really worked I was fascinated by all the things that Tom Hanks character was doing Also I found myself tempted to talk to the screen to give the guy ideas A couple of people who I talked to after the movie said that only Tom Hanks could have pulled off that role Yeah I think so too Tom Hanks did a great job I think that Tom Hanks might receive a nomination for Best Actor wow once again for his role in this film

This film made me understand how art was invented how man discovered the usefullness of tools why man gives such immense mythical sense to the symbols he invents Cast away on a desert island alone in the most absolute meaning of the word no other animate creature accept fish ever comes across Hanks path during his stay on the island jet flying hard working Hanks is reduced to the state of primitive man There is nothing around him which can help him survive His landing on the island is his DAY ZERO However fate first comes to his rescue when he is unsuccessfully trying to break the hard shell of a coconut with a piece of what appears to be volcanic rock The rock splinters but what remains in his hand is a piece of rock which has a sharp edge a knife From then on he can split open his coconuts with ease It seems that coconut and fishes are the only things Hanks eats on the island Hanks seems to be extremely scrupuolous in his profession He only opens the packages which drift into the island with him after a few days not at once In one of them he finds a volleyball for which he cannot figure out any use Sometime later Hanks angrily hits this volleyball with his hand full of blood after he cuts himself while trying to get some fire burning The red hand shaped stain on the ball appears to Hanks as if it were a face and so it becomes his friend and companion on the island Wilson The attachment Hanks develops to this symbol will be very evident later on in the film I believe that there are just good films and bad films nothing else This is a good film Hanks has reached another dimension in his acting and really I doubt whether there is any other actor around nowadays who can so easily adapt himself to such varied roles as being a simpleton in Forrest Gump an astronaut in Apollo 13 and a modern day Robinson Crusoe in this film Marvellous Well what can I say I think this comment is long enough as it is GO SEE THE MOVIE

review_title: Didn't know if I liked it or not as I walked out
review_comment: Then as I was driving home and thinking about the movie a little more I realized that this movie unlike any other movie I had ever seen kept me glued to my seat without having a disaster around every corner The two movies to which I got dragged this past year ended up being the two best movies I saw Gladiator was great with Maximus s fall from glory and rise to victory once more and then I went to see Castaway Castaway managed to keep my intention without the tenseness of a movie such as Jaws It was so refreshing to sit back and enjoy a great movie without disaster after disaster Chuck walks through the water on the rocks with blood gushing from his leg no shark attack He stands on the edge of the rock cliff no slip of the toe to send him over He sails out to sea once more on his makeshift raft he s still laying on that raft when he gets rescued Yes a movie can be refreshing exciting and riveting without all those movie disasters we ve all come to expect Two thumbs up to Hanks and Zemeckis for a wonderfully made film I would pay 10 to see it again

I liked the movie Tom had my undivided attention for 145 minutes and I am a critic of the Survivor concept I think the movie is so popular because everyone can relate to the isolation loss confusion and despair that life can offer Tom had to decide what to do at year 3 when he was at the pinnacle and when he saw Helen Hunt after 5 years away He had to find a way to move on even though it was as difficult as living on the island I realize there were many rational questions Why wouldn t he open a box after 4 1 2 years of looking at it How could he survive without a good supply of fresh water How could he make it on a raft even though the island is only 25 miles north of Nada in Fiji They did actually have to stop filming several times to let boats pass I think it is a testament of the human spirit and a great movie

I listened about the Golden Globe that Tom Hanks received I listened everyone saying that it s a great movie and all but as far as I m concerned it was a boring movie with mediocre acting and a slow and meaningless scenario

review_title: I enjoyed the film , but felt it needed more.
review_comment: I just saw this movie this evening and I will say there are many moments were I cringed and felt so sorry to Chuck Tom Hanks but I wish there hadn t been such a gap between him being cast away and four years later still there Also I found there was a lack of plot line You never saw what the other side was doing to find him I like and disliked that It was most certainly a one man show and Tom Hanks did a GREAT performance but with a little bit more footage and script this movie could have been better PS Close your eyes for the teeth extraction scene OUch

I was disappointed by this movie Tom Hanks is very good as usual but the film is somehow too long and you end up with the feeling that you have been watching the world longest advert for FedEx Don t get me wrong there is a lot of good in this movie and the survival on the island is nerve cracking

review_title: could a good movie kill us?
review_comment: first of all i have to advise that my english writing is not fluent as i would like in the second place i think that loneliness as well as fear of living are concepts not easy to be filmed well nobody says that CAST AWAY is a masterpiece but also i ve seen that nobody made a proper objection in this list i m afraid that there was superficiality of arguments and too much criticism by the people who stuck on things such as the marketing plane of fedex or the actors role in this movie i struggled rather a lot in my life and i still feel completely alone there isn t a family a friend a job a work or a religion that could calm or satisfy me this feeling doesn t leave me a second in life and i think also that doesn t exist a remedy to this never it will be the final ppp of tom hanks could be a plausible answer to who understand what i have affirmed before you can t fight it so why don t you accept it in addition this film got all the faults of hollywood industry s films a budget too big many commercials in it and so on but it gives a strong really strong sensation that never let me quiet during the film feeling of angst this artificial and commercial film can give me the same sensation i had during the worse moments in my life so that i feel worried for two reasons mainly the first is how long establishment could manipulate feeling and emotions and secondly what they would to achieve spectators especially young people are gonna be more and more disillusioned of this kind of stories and that is a pity really i say that is a pity because this side of industry is gonna kill every part of good feeling or mood inside us anyway i appreciated this film more than it was expected 7 10

i cannot help but agree that the first 2 3 of the movie is particularly moving without much of the usual cliches the plane crash and thereafter is so realistic that i was actually scared like by a horror movie The scenes on the island were without music or effects and it is SO RIGHT to portray it that way I could almost feel Chuck s solitude I actually cried a little when Chuck lost Wilson at sea something i don t usually do these days at the movies Unfortunately the whole part when he went back to Memphis was done all wrong How i wished it was better

review_title: A better end for a perfect movie!
review_comment: I went to the movies yesterday evening to build my own point of view about this movie I had already heard 3 or 4 different opinions about it disliking ones and the best movie I ve ever seen ones as well Facing all that I went there and checked it up with my own eyes Zemeckis and Hanks proved once more the amazing acting they can construct together Tom was perfect as usual but with an important plus he was acting perfectly without interacting I believe he had to double his talent if we consider a talent like that can be doubled what I personally doubt about to act without interacting at least with another human being I watched the movie understanding that the main message it wanted to pass was about a man s behavior on the total loneliness fighting for keeping himself alive even though he had no reason to breath It showed me how strong a human being can be and for how long we are probably able to stand being lonely without going crazy The need Chuck reveals creating Mr Wilson proves that a normal human being has to have someone by his side especially in the difficult times and when it is about making an important decision I kept asking myself what would kill me first thirsty hunger or loneliness For thirsty Chuck had coconuts and rain for hunger Chuck had fish and for loneliness Chuck had nothing except himself with a bloody face a teddy bear a children sleeps with replaced by a friendly bloody face volleyball that helped him out as long as he had to keep himself alive on the island Why do children like so much their teddy bears Because they can feel protected and with company when their are lonely in bad at night Wilson was one of the factors to keep Chuck alive such as water and fish Spoiler alert The movie would have been perfect for me if it could have ended up differently I went back home imagining what end I would like this movies to have for it to be perfect but I could not figure what kind of end it would be Did anybody think about anything I just know that it was not the one I ve seen at the movies with Tom Hanks in the middle of the road looking at the truck of a strange woman that happened to be the owner of the package he chose to be the one he had to keep intact while he was lost That end made me so sad I really wanted to see a better end for such an amazing movie But afterwards the movie s end did not jeopardize the majesty of the entire story and the magnitude of Hanks acting I could feel my emotions coming out by watching Chuck s strength Until yesterday I was sure about my wish for Geoffrey Rush winning the Oscar Quills but I have to admit now I believe Tom Hanks deserves the Oscar more than ever Today I have my own opinion about Cast away a very good movie with a perfect performance by Tom Hanks but with an end I still have to create in my own mind to make it one of the bests I have ever seen in my whole life

As it seems with most of Tom Hanks movies he is reaching for a role that will get him an Oscar or nomination he never takes any roles that don t stand a chance at winning the Oscars though there are some humorous parts in the movie it is nothing that was Oscar worthy The story isn t written that well and tom hanks acting isn t on par with many other actors at this time such as Clive Owen Other than this that the rest of the cast doesn t do nearly as good of a job as selling the role they should be able to Of course it also seems that they tied on a major company such as FedEx which although pays for some of the movie it kind of sells out the story

review_title: There's not much to eat on one island.
review_comment: The last time we were treated to the Tom Hanks State of the Union speech was at the 2001 Golden Globe Awards ceremony You knew something was up when he accepted Best Actor without the usual tears streaming or welling up on his face Tom Hanks is getting used to this Hanks is a brilliant actor and luckily for him a movie has been made that stages his abilities yet once again Cast Away is a refreshing adventure movie set in the Pacific where else when it comes to major routes via FedEx Yes there is a plane crash Hanks character Noland survives the crash without injuries and manages to stay afloat in his rubber dinghy until dry lands arrives I am not giving away much considering most of the spoilers are left to the theatrical trailer Director Robert Zemeckis is successful at reminding us in this world of technology and plentiful relationships that we really can be alone on this planet Hanks evolves his character with typical mastery He uses restraint when necessary and builds suspense as we wonder How would I react in a situation like that Hanks answers all of these questions depending on little dialogue while on the island In a cinematic impossibility Zemeckis forms the key element to this film that would have suffered without it a relationship with Wilson a volleyball that washes also ashore The relationship between Hanks and the Volleyball works The film might have been boring with unrealistic conversations talking to oneself serving no purpose except to inform the audience Here Hanks serves up a memorable performance engaging Wilson and continually validates the drama that unfolds on the island At either end of the island adventure exists the real world and Hanks tether to his rat in a maze existence His love interest with Helen Hunt is weak it seems and we are left to wonder how strong their relationship is given the circumstances Zemeckis forms a series of events where Hanks s courier work stands in the way of any serious love interest not the plug FedEx was looking for I m sure Unfortunately there is not a lot of time to evolve any of the other characters and for this reason this film is not robust enough to be an Oscar winner for Best Picture What is effective is the feeling of isolation on the island Zemeckis is artful in his use of sweeping panoramic movements with the camera Few movies have come close in also stranding the audience Finally the scenes back in civilisation pale in comparison to the ordeal on the island I wish Zemeckis had shortenened the ending dramatically for a more powerful transition in plot The final ten minutes were disappointing as Zemeckis attempts an epilogue rather amateurishly The crash of the airplane is breathtaking Hanks deserves another Oscar on his mantle The movie is extremely entertaining despite shortcomings with development of non essential staff The morale of this story should be Make every departure a meaningful one You never know what will happen on your next business trip overseas That swiss army knife is not just decorative either 7 5 10

The movie was very good but I couldn t help but be very bothered by the obvious FedEx commercials with which the entire movie is packed Two scenes were particularly disturbing a in the beginning when Chuck trains the Russian staff on the corporate values of FedEx b well surpassed by the final scene when he delivers the FedEx parcel after all pathetic They must have paid a fortune for the movie and in the credits no FedEx to be seen Thus mark 3 out of 10 Otherwise it would have been a higher mark They could have gone for a fictitious parcel delivery firm and they just about might have made it for an Oscar It s also surprising of Zemeckis to have allowed this I remain quite puzzled A pity thought

A brief scan over the premise of this movie brings of concern Can one man really be entertaining for all that time How interesting can four years on an island be However I was pleasently surprised but not overly Tom Hanks manages to keep your attention his subtle but significant characted journey is absorbing The various tasks he must carry out to stay alive are interesting perhaps only academically and not dramtically A sense of humour prods the story along The direction for me is what saves the movie however Instead of the bright colours of a dream like island we see shades pastels Infact the island is rather grim Time is used wonderfully from the fast paced world to the timelessness and lonelyness are expertly portrayed Silence black screens both forgotten devices are used to great effect here Even the four years later although perhaps cliche perhaps a little lazy gives the feeling of nothingness that helps us to feel his isolation Although a little too long perhaps not a master piece this film has a great deal to offer in its details Daring in superfical minimalism and deeply considered beneath the surface this film will be enjoyed by those who like to work hard with their viewing
