Judging from other comments already posted Cast Away has touched as many people as it has left others mildly indifferent I watched it in the cosiness of my living room on a pretty smart digital wide screen TV and found it riveting It is a bit long and disjointed and the least that could be said is that the transitions between consecutive periods in the movie are too abrupt I guess this can happen when one tries to cover several years in a two and a half hour piece but the lack of smooth transitions destroys the rhythm of the movie So why did I find it riveting First and foremost Tom Hanks makes an outstanding Robinson Crusoe Credible from the first minute to the last he adds to a great acting performance the physical prowess of changing body shapes One minute a chubby over fed executive the next a survivor close to starvation The credibility of his acting brings out one of the main messages of the movie Corporate America and the pseudo comfort it creates but which comfort does Chuck Noland enjoy when travelling from continent to continent in the back of a FedEx aircraft mainly serves the purpose of alienating human beings by destroying their relationship to nature Ok some of you will find this statement far fetched and Chuck Noland certainly did not crash his plane to enjoy a return to nature However I took the contrast between a life in the fast lane and the painstakingly slow pace of survival as a reminder that we should not rely on appearances too much it doesn t always matter if things happen a few minutes too late Beyond the thought provoking aspects of the movie I enjoyed some superb photography and scenery as well as a good plane crash scene What I wasn t impressed with too many FedEx signs around but then this is corporate America and Hollywood

review_title: All that you can't leave behind
review_comment: I saw Tom Hanks sell me this movie for the second time this previous saturday evening When you watch a man cast away every major component of his life one by one clothes body fat human contact comfort the pressure of time a portion of sanity and then see whats left behind The first act plane crash is phenomenal You will NEVER take your shoes off in an airplane again or be without a Leatherman tool When Chuck first lands on the island i was made to feel like the island itself is a creature a being a thing that imprisons it KEEPS you On the horizon you COULD be free but you CAN T GET there And you watch Chuck Chuck is REAL And so are His frustrations his pain his discomfort his joy in triumph When he makes fire I shouted with him I too find myself wanting to get back to Kelly to hear a human voice to be warm at night to not be thirsty anymore Chuck s numerous transformations make me feel like i went through them with him During the second act after four years has passed it felt like chuck had crawled into a cave and what was left was all that he couldn t leave behind or throw away Just surviving Staying alive Then one day the tide brings in his way off In this film you will watch a man CHANGE Tom Hanks makes me believe in a character like never before in a film I BELIEVE him I BELIEVE he has thrown overboard every thing that was of no use to him in order to survive in order to LIVE WhatEVER it takes to live was what i thought about as i left the theater and to ENJOY your life and enjoy every LITTLE thing Ice Sheets A cup of HOT coffee Human touch MUSIC What if i couldn t listen to music for 4 years A kiss from a woman again 4 years Savoring every last good thing in my life In the word s of U2 this film challenged me to in my own life throw overboard the worthless junk that will hinder me and keep all that i can t leave behind and enjoy Go see it wait And then see it again By the way and this is seen in the previews When Chuck says at the beginning of the film We live or we die by The Clock he has a pager with a clock a digital watch clocks in the warehouse etc and at the end notice he wears no watch

review_title: The script is an overlooked gem
review_comment: Everyone knows about Tom Hanks Zemeckis s string of huge successes Wilson the Volleyball the beautiful scenery etc But what stands out to me about Cast Away after 20 years is William Broyles s script You re thinking wait there s almost no words for much of the film Right but when you dig into the script and pay attention to it and to the plot what you find is a surprisingly profound examination of the concept of time in modern vs Pre modern society You can view the whole movie as a man s transformation through great pain into a life that is a rejection of the every second matters mania that drives global businesses while also making time spent with loved ones even friends fleeting and fragmented Broyles gave us a big clue with his title for the script Cast Away Where did that title come from Why isn t it Castaway the normal spelling for someone stranded on an island I pondered over this for years and finally realized that it s from the famous passage from Ecclesiastes 3 in the Judeo Christian scriptures i e For everything there is a season or Turn Turn Turn by The Byrds same thing Verse 6 A time to get and a time to lose a time to keep and a time to cast away And there you have it Cast Away is at its core a meditation on time Those who find the film boring completely miss the point

This is a great film but falls flat in the ending The first problem I have with any movie with Tim Hanks in it anymore is that I cannot forget that it is Tom Hanks I am watching Fortunately Tom Hanks is such a good actor that I find myself watching him as if he were actually in the situation the movie puts him in So in Saving Private Ryan for me its more like watching Tom Hanks actually being in WWII having to lead a squad of men to save a Pvt Ryan And in this movie it was like watching what happens to Tom Hanks when he is stranded on an island in the middle of the Pacific ocean Anyhow his acting is superb here which is fortunate since a huge middle portion is almost exclusively of him on the island How he deals with existing on the island was fascinating to watch And the device of having him befriend a volleyball was a great idea The depiction of the plane crash was one of the best I ve seen of that kind of catastrophe I was very impressed with the way the events in the interior of the plane were shown It made me feel like that is what it truly would be like if that happened The ending unfortunately nearly ruins the movie for me Spoiler warning When Chuck finally escapes and returns home he finds his former fiance is now married with children Quite believable so far so good She initially can t deal with even meeting him which is also understandable given how much her world has just been turned upside down with his return In fact the movie does well in the ending up to and during his visit to her house at night You remain on edge somewhat because they are uncomfortable and awkward with each other They wind up in her garage where she gives him the keys to the Jeep they had when they were previously together He pulls out of the driveway begins to leave and at that point the movie blows it big time She rushes out into the rain calling after him and he somehow hears her backs up and they embrace and kiss etc Yes their love never died but circumstances force them apart This struck me as so Hollywood so pandering to the audience as to be almost sickening A far better and more likely outcome would be that they never get over the awkward uncomfortable feeling between each other and he drives off with both of them silently accepting what they have been dealt The film could have even shown each character her in the garage him driving away in the Jeep break down in tears But it ruins it that they connect The situation is a tragedy and should be shown as tragic The audience can tell well enough if they still have feelings for one another I can t say how the movie should have concluded but the last scenes with him at a crossroads in Texas wondering where to go next weren t convincing either The ending definitely needs a lot of rethinking End of spoilers Overall I am glad I saw this movie and would recommend it Just be aware that it breaks down in the end But everything prior to that still makes it worth seeing 7 10

hi this is sarah iam a student am 14 but i saw cast away the movie when it frist came out it was an awsome movie it was sad happy funny and some parts people where mad and feeling worryed i really enjoyed it very much it something cought me in the movie that i never felt in a movie before it was an good movie i think it would be good for the whole famly to see it there is not a single bad part in it from sarah

I saw this movie today again and I feel this is a fresh movie When Chuck Noland says Hello anybody at that time I was really weird more than him I think castaway is not only a servable movie If anybody says this is an only servable movie that would be an insult for this movie In this movie human physical and emotional express batter way in this movie Tom Hanks is a workaholic and he loves his work very much Castaway directed by Robert Zemeckis is a 2001 film starring Tom Hanks Hanks stars as Chuck Noland during the family Christmas dinner Chuck is summoned to resolve a work problem in Malaysia FedEx delivery man whose life is headed in the right direction at a time his plane crashes and he is stranded on an island He must adapt to his new life on the island to survive to overcome many obstacles Castaway explores three different journeys physical and imaginative The physical journey in Castaway is Chuck s struggle to survive the entire movie His determination and faith serve to call optimism within the responder and it gives them hope that Chuck will continue to survive until he gets off the island The impact time has on his life is also evident when he is admonishing FedEx employees He states We live or we die by the clock Never allow ourselves to commit the sin of losing track of time He says the same thing to the volleyball Wilson when he is planning their escape off the island The context of when he says it changes the meaning of this recovery The first time it is said he is passionately trying to get workers to be more efficient and the recovery is a color The second time Chuck makes this remark death is a serious option Although the timing of his escape is important to him time is not what is driving him anymore instead of his desire to get back to Kelly The volleyball Wilson becomes Chuck s only companion on the island Wilson is Chuck s need for companionship personified Hanks proves here again what an effective actor he is never straining for an effect I liked every scene on the island and wanted more of them Castaway is one of those classic movies that everyone must see The plot is uncommon and it was very interesting I say that every element of the film was perfect The acting is very good although there are only two real sources of acting in this film Tom Hanks and Helen Hunt There is also a good deal of comedy in the film and it is done very well This is one of the few films that I strongly recommend you watch Although if you are not a fan of Tom Hanks then you might have some trouble with this film because a great deal of the film is him alone on an island So I hope you watch the film I love this film I hope that you enjoy it I give it 10

I liked the movie It was thoughtful and adventurous It was done in a real time basis that many people can relate to these days how we get caught up in things like work time management etc Question for movie buffs what was spraying Chuck while he was on the wood raft The first time it happened was at night when he saw the whale It happens twice more during the day once when Wilson disappears and once when the ship passes But it doesn t show what s causing it Is it just normal ocean spray or is the whale back Was the whale helping Chuck if it was the whale I think they should ve revealed that fact more it could ve been a cool touch

Now I m not picking on anyone but for those who thought that this movie was shallow obviously didn t understand it From begginning to end this movie was almost perfect Every part of it held a metaphorical meaning to it I loved it Tom Hanks plays a Fed Ex employee who falls victim to a plane crash and is stranded on a nearby island He is the only survivor and if forced to create a second home on this small island Because the plane was a Fed Ex one many packages are washed up to shore about 15 He opens them and uses each to his advantage In the midst of all this panic he finds the time to befriend a volley ball he calls Wilson This ball doubles as his alter ego and is the only thing keeping him from going insane I never liked Tom Hanks as an actor until this movie I thought he did a superb job in this role and that was one of the best parts SPOILER His girlfriend getting married was a given because you can t expect her to stay alone hoping for his return And although he is sad of this it is implied at the end that he will make a new life with this kind hearted country women who Saved his life END OF SPOILER I really thought that this movie had everything it could have No more no less

review_title: Overall I enjoyed it, but.. *Possible Spoiler*
review_comment: Possible Spoiler if you don t know the basic plot line from the ads This movie was amazing in many ways with the dramatic Tom Hanks weight loss being an obvious stand out The scenes on the island were awesome and the behind the scenes footage on the DVD was interesting especially the negotiations with the native Fijian inhabitants I had heard that there was minimal dialogue and soundtrack throughout much of the movie which I thought worked very well with Tom Hanks remaining on my list of actors with under rated ability The bad The movie dragged too long in the post island scenes for my taste and I didn t feel like we got enough back in the final scene after going through the uncomfortable reunion with his girlfriend Also I listened to the commentary track in a few instances hoping for insight into why they wrote scenes the way they did and was disappointed with repetitive discussion of camera angles and techniques instead My opinion but I don t like how it could be seen that Tom is ready to drive away with her at the end and then appears sullen that she needs to go back to her life Worth watching but I don t know about repeated viewing

review_title: Excellent film about acceptance and loss
review_comment: Great film with great performances The setup and delivery of his relationship and the effect his plane crash has on him and his friends life s is well done and how the island is viewed by Noland is very well handled as it comes across that he hates the island for trapping him there but grateful that it s the thing allowing him to stay alive His escape to sea on his raft and as he looks back on the island the films score marries with he imagery perfectly and of course Wilson an Oscar worthy performance from a prop and luckily the producers didn t go with initial idea of casting Paul Walker in the role of Wilson they even had a large costume of a volleyball made up

Tom Hanks did a splendid job in this film It took guts to do all that was required from the start to the finish from gaining all that weight and then letting it fall off as the film progressed to being basically the sole character having the entire film rest upon his shoulders from his performance That had to be quite a burden But He pulled it off and did a gutsy job and it was quite an experience to go through it all with him After all WE WERE WITH HIM ON THAT ISLAND We learned lessons right along with him and his character s dedication to his job held him together and gave him something to hold onto after all he DID deliver that package that he held onto for all those years Now THAT S dedication I loved the film watched it 3 times and I d watch it again

review_title: Great movie that is very spiritual
review_comment: While I don t feel it was as brilliant as many have said it was a very good movie that had some excellent points to make about life All in all this is a movie that can easily be enjoyed Spoiler Before I saw it I was afraid that the ending would be your traditional guy gets rescued and reunited with girl everyone lives happily ever after I was very pleased to see that this wasn t the case For those that think spiritualness can only be expressed by praying then they don t understand the subtlety of spiritualness The film depicted spirituality with the symbolism of the whale looking out for Hanks Was he just cruising around looking for a meal or did he understand in someway that another of God s creatures was in need and was trying to help The ending also showed a spiritual side in connecting the package to Hank s ultimate destiny His true destiny did not lie in Helen Hunt but possibly in someone he had never met and a deeper understanding of life

Originally I passed on this film fearing the 2 1 2 hr length Now that I have seen it my main question is What was the point the director was trying to make Philosophical regarding Hank s concept of time SPOILER as a FedEx manager he fights it as a castaway he endures it as a returning survivor he must accept it s passing Survival skills In that case not enough was shown Romance Hank s relationship w Hunt was shown very briefly in the beginning The ending ran the risk of making too much of them and personally I did not really care Also C MON SPOILER An unopened package for 4 years Who bankrolled this flick FedEx Plus maybe I missed something but what was the point of SPOILER the package delivered in Russia I wish the director had decided what direction he wanted this film to go in and stuck to it

The only thing I likes about this movie was Tom Hanks The direction of this film was very poor Tons of loop holes I like the first half of the movie but after he was rescued the movie sucked Didn t make any sense

In 1995 Chuck Noland a process analyst travels the world to solve manufacturing problems at the Federal Express Company He lives in Memphis Tennessee with his girlfriend Kelly Frears The couple wanted to get married but Chuck s work schedule got in the way During the family Christmas dinner Chuck is invited to solve a work problem in Malaysia A Federal Express plane traveling in a storm caught and crashed in the Pacific Ocean Chuck is the sole survivor of the crash and escapes in an inflatable lifeboat losing the emergency detector in the process The next day he will end up on a deserted island Over the next few days several Federal Express packages crash along with the body of one of the Federal Express pilots which Chuck buries Chuck tries to flag down a passing boat and escape in a damaged lifeboat but an incoming wave throws him onto a coral reef injuring his leg It finds enough food water and shelter Chuck opens many packages finding many valuables but does not open the package with golden angel wings painted on it While trying to start a fire Chuck cuts his hand He angrily threw away several items from the package including a Wilson Sporting soccer ball leaving a bloody handprint When he calmed down Chuck drew a blood smeared face played Wilson s ball and started talking to him He continued to talk to her regularly for the rest of his time on the island

review_title: Castaway: stuck on an island an stuck in time
review_comment: Tom Hanks portrays Chuck a Fedex businessman with a hectic schedule and lofty ambitions Although it is a really emotive film it moves more slowly than a sloth on steroids Chuck Nolan is in Moscow trying to quickly spread Fedex s magic as a harried businessman with a full schedule After an incredible plane accident compared to the rest of the film he joins a flight home He is imprisoned on an island The pace of the film is incredibly slow with one scene taking two minutes when ten seconds would have sufficed to achieve the same effect This film could have reached the top 5 with a different director bye bye Robert Zemeckis The FedEx logo was seen in almost every shot throughout the 2 hours and 23 minutes of the FedEx advertisement A Many of the scenes consist solely of Chuck s locket or a random FedEx parcel with an upset Chuck There is no drama just one big issue being stranded on an island The movie becomes even more agonisingly slow as a result What occurs after that according to the ambiguous ending As there is no tension it is hardly a cliffhanger rather it is more like the movie ran out of money before it could finish He is alone and gradually becoming insane which is one of the film s most compelling emotional elements Everyone is moved when he befriends a volleyball named Wilson this is perhaps the only reason I would see it again The only real improvements to the film come from Wilson and the plane accident JusticeForWilson Overall this film should be condemned to remain in the 2000s if my children wanted to watch it I would disown them The survival action genre has been ruined by this film which makes Bear Grylls look like a girl scout Go ahead and watch it if you want but be prepared for your popcorn to vanish before the action begins My suggestion Burn everything keep the next generation from it

This movie is about a man who gets stranded on a deserted island This character is named Chuck played by Tom Hanks Chuck works at FedEx flying from country to country making sure that packages get to their destination in the shortest amount of time possible A couple of days before Christmas he was forced to go on a business trip As everyone knows that it is always when things are going well that they are bound to go wrong sooner rather than later Right before he boards the plane he proposes to his girlfriend Kelly who is played by Helen Hunt It is on that flight that things go bad The plane gets trapped in a storm and the pilots are not able to communicate to others through the radio Somehow after the plane crashing into the ocean Chuck miraculously survives Unfortunately the pilots were not as lucky Eventually while floating on the plane s emergency raft Chuck wakes up to realize that he is on a deserted island in complete loneliness He then makes a very strong effort to stay alive using every survival skill known to him He gathers all of the FedEx packages that are washed up onto the beach At first he plans to keep all of them closed until somebody showed up Later in the movie he realizes that he might never be found So he opens up all of the packages except for one and in one of those packages was his new friend Wilson brand volleyball that he named Wilson This movie does an excellent job with the picture and sound The writers and editors do a great job in making this movie interesting since it is all about one man stuck on an island Tom Hanks does a tremendous job playing the role of Chuck It is especially challenging to play this part since there is barely any dialogue Because of this the writers and editors has to emphasize other aspects For example the sound of nature took the biggest role in this movie There was not one second where you could not hear the sound of the waves crashing into the sand In this movie Chuck grew as a person and fought for his life every single day What kept him motivated was his fianc e Kelly One of the most brilliant aspects of this movie was Wilson The volleyball that kept him company kept him motivated and eventually became his best friend Apart from adding more to that story Wilson also helped bring in more dialogue into the movie In the end of the movie there is an interesting romantic twist that you would have never imagined This is all explains why this movie is one of the best movies ever made

There are too many movie watchers that have no depth Reading the last few posts persuaded me not to spend time trying to strengthen the emotional misfits that need their head petted to feel secure Most movies including Cast Away have depth beyond the understanding of even the above average person What a person can not see feel when they watch a movie determines the level of their understanding of the story or it s meaning It was an above average movie lost on too many deadheads

review_title: Greatest Product Placement in Film History
review_comment: Spoiler Alert Since the famous Taco Bell scene in Demolition Man it must have been difficult to position a movie to be any more like an advertisement Nonetheless Cast Away has done it The first 20 minutes of the film are a huge FedEx advertisement and the rest of the film is punctuated by FedEx ads every 15 minutes or so just like watching a film on TV Truely a masterpiece of product placement Despite my reservations for such annoyance couldn t they have invented a generic package company Ace Delivery or something this film remains entertaining My only other complain is the sappy and annoying reuinification with Tom Hanks chilly wife who finds it impossible to see him again How lame

Once again Hanks makes a smashing hit with the critics and at the box office with his Film Cast Away I ll be right back says Chuck Noland Tom Hanks to his girlfriend Kelly Frears Helen Hunt right after he gives her a ring box hinting a marriage proposal when he returns from his business trip Only Chuck didn t return until four years later Cast Away is a film of love and survival that resides on the shoulders of Chuck Noland Chuck is a FedEx system Engineer who travels around the world to teach the importance of a speedy delivery to other FedEx couriers During a flight his plane hits a thunderstorm that sends it into the Pacific Ocean Only Chuck survives He floats in a life raft to a deserted island with only a few FedEx packages as the only remains Robert Zemeckis did an excellent job directing while Hank s did an even more excellent job acting out two thirds of the movie on his own The only dialogue during this time is when Chuck speaks to Wilson Wilson the volleyball comes from a left over FedEx package and has a face drawn on with Chuck s blood This movie has an emotional tug and it makes us feel just like we are on the island with Chuck The ending to the movie isn t the normal perfect ending It has a real life twist of how people move on with their lives even after a tragedy This movie is a survival drama we should not miss

review_title: Uplifting and heartfelt film about life and survival
review_comment: An excellent work of Zemeckis and Hanks who succeeded in bringing to the screen the emotions without action This film makes us think about real treasures of the world and our lives in it An Oscar performance by Hanks unfortunately underrated Splendid

review_title: Brilliant portrayal of one man's struggle with solitude...
review_comment: Cast Away is an excellent portrayal of one man s determination to stay alive no matter how impossible the situation seems to be After a freak storm sends a Federal Express plane down in the Pacific Ocean Chuck Noland Tom Hanks is the only survivor Clinging to an emergency raft that he found during the plane s decent into the raging ocean he eventually drifts onto a deserted tropical island He quickly learns how to survive in this harsh environment but reality sinks in as he realizes that there can be no rescue from this isolation After a while Chuck begins to lose what sanity he has left and befriends a volleyball Wilson that he accidentally imprints with his bloody hand Chuck and Wilson remain on this island for three long years until the winds and tides are right for getting his handmade boat off the island Hanks does a brilliant job of bringing to life the agony and despair of being the sole human operator in complete isolation His monologues with Wilson which he actually believes is communicating with him keep him focused on making the boat and his undying love of his wife Helen Hunt keep driving him to strive against all odds I give this movie 9 and a half stars out of 10 because the ending is a little too open

review_title: Deepest film ever from a Taoist perspective (SPOILERS)
review_comment: It is all all about shedding the ego Chuck has a HUGE ego Not in the sense that he is a jerk or selfish but in the Buddhist way definition of ego he think he can control everything ego and lives totally in time ego and puts his job first because it creates a sense of order ego and so on He puts more stock in giving Kelly a ring at the car than staying behind to be with her for the holidays because to the Ego a ring is more important than the relationship Ego loves symbols and form more than what is behind them However the universe endlessly tests his ego by showing him that he is actually powerless Which he cannot accept First he is in Russia and he gets the clock that he sent himself and it took many days to get there and shows him he is out of control But he makes that everyone else s problem and even steals a kids bicycle to speed up the package delivery he is willing to do anything to regain control rather than accept any powerlessness Then his friends wife is dying and he again can t accept his own powerlessness and suggests a doctor to fix this thing Which of course he can t It s death Since Kelly knows what he loves best she gives him a watch because time is the only thing he finds valuable ego And then the plane goes down On the island he is endlessly shown how powerless he is and again wont accept it He cant make fire he cant eat his tooth is decayed But he wont accept it he keeps trying to overcome it with reason He still is collecting packages Finally he cant even kill himself correctly At this point is his first glimpse at a higher self because later when he tells the story to his friend he say that when he realized that he couldn t even kill himself a warm feeling came over him and stayed with him This is his first moment of enlightenment a forced realization that he is totally powerless and thus a moment of forced alignment with something higher Then it takes four more years of ego battering before he has let go of ego enough internally to be able to just float where the winds take you as Lao tze says literally as a sail comes in But when he gets home his dormant ego flares up again as it tries to control the uncontrollable he still hasn t totally learned So he tries to get Kelly back instead of accepting the situation thus he is still on the island in his head which is a metaphor for separateness No man is an island The island IS Ego itself in the third act every time his ego flares up and he is trying to control things again there is a clock in the background he is still stuck in time Again his ego is pummeled and he must accept his own powerlessness And then finally BOOM it really all comes at once he lets go He accepts his own total powerlessness totally and gets in a car and gets to a crossroads having no idea for once in his life where he is going At which point his angel arrives His angel tests him one last time She tells him that to the right is Flagstaff but back the way she is going is a whole lot of nothing In the end he looks back toward nothingness the direction she is going and we know he is going to choose the road to nothingness instead of the known destination of Flagstaff because he has released his ego accepted powerlessness He is now capable of drifting powerlessly toward nothingness which is really not nothing at all it is an alignment with the Universe Especially so because the cute girl with the wings lives in that direction and they may fall in love One last great thing here When he went to her ranch to leave the package She has removed the Name Dick from Dick and Bettina and this now it only says Bettina From a symbolic perspective the Dick male organ ego has been removed which represent man and power and only the feminine power is left the return of the feminine power is associated in Joseph Campbell as mans realignment with God Bettina which in Hebrew means God s Promise And finally he stand on a cross crossroads resurrected Wow Moral of the story To shed the ego totally accept your powerlessness You will be tested again and again till you genuinely do this When the ego is shed then the true self the one aligned with the Universe and God Can emerge and take you where you need to go as you are now part of the whole

I felt like I cast away my money on the ticket Very little happened on the Island Tom Hanks was probably more interested in getting to his next feature film instead of doing a quality job of acting in this film This is a problem with top tier actors Too many films to star in and not enough time to spend doing a quality job in all of them The producer thinks that having Tom Hanks and Helen Hunt in a film is going to get people into the theater no matter what quality film is produced The funny thing is that both actors are A list actors This film lacks originality creativity and is boring This is more of a drama than an action film Tom Hanks is great in Saving Private Ryan and Forest Gump If you read this review try checking those out

It is a long time four years on a deserted island but perhaps even longer for the spectator who does not have Wilson around but who cannot resist looking at his watch too Robinson Crusoe was a wonderful book but even with an optimistic romantic ending CAST AWAY can be disposed of right away

review_comment: What 18 ish years can do to an opinion Well rewatch Cast Away and find out I used to think it boring Now I see it stands the time just about as well as Tom Hanks did does Great watch highly recommended

warning contains mild spoilers This is the most pointless unnecessarily long expensive movie I ve ever seen Even tho I m a Hanks fan the largely plotless clunker covers 2 1 2 hrs that you could better spend having fun or trying out 2 or 3 other flicks Also if you don t like violent accident images avoid because of the crash There were many ways this could have been made into a more thought provoking movie such as having Hanks keep a journal where his thoughts could have been revealed as they evolved over all that time At best a 2 out of 10

review_title: Tennyson's "Enoch Arden" updated for the jet age.
review_comment: Tom Hanks gives another great performance in a pretty good movie although I think UPS should sue for equal time I give it an A for the first and second sections a B for the final section However this ISN T an updated version of Robinson Crusoe It s an update of Lord Tennyson s mini epic poem Enoch Arden which was filmed a half dozen times during the silent film era

I was watching this movie after 11 years from the date of realize I want to rate this as 9 10 because It is the best it makes me involved in the movie it makes me to think what ll be doing if was in his shoes my mom used to say no one knows how to do everything but they ll learn to do things eventually by the help of the time I mean the time is the best teacher of all time I cannot imagine how I would have survived in the middle of the earth with no living around me no place to save my head no place to protect my self I can hardly swim its hard to survive with all the supplies in this world now a days but I cannot imagine who one can survive without anything to his her supplies I ll definitely be screaming all the time with pain and frustration eventually it ll be habituated though I ll definitely be singing moaning all the time I lost so many dear friends and I know how it feels like to loose only friend no matter what it is after all staying with Wilson for 1500 days and nights is really painful This movie was well directed without any flaws And Thanks to Sir Tom Hanks for the incredible performance Overall this movie is awesome This was my first movie review please correct me if I have any flaws I would like to improve myself

review_title: One of the most under rated films iv'e ever seen.
review_comment: Cast Away Coming in to Cast Away I had high hopes for a film starring one of my favourite actors Tom Hanks and the director of my favorite film Forrest Gump I was not disappointed The directing was amazing he stretched the limits of his directing from exotic shots of Tom going around the island and the emotion and lessons of the film Another great thing about this films is the relationship between the Chuck Noland and Wilson the volleyball who ends up having the most emotional scene in the entire film Ultimately i gave this film 9 out of 10 for its emotion excitement its score life lessons and Tom Hanks with a beard

Just as i began watching this movie firstly i had no idea that at the end of it i would feel emotion towards it For me it quite simply showed what an amazing and influential actor Tom Hanks is when he was the only character viewed for most of the movie along with Wilson It was just Tom for a long period of time and that was bliss Towards the end just as tom is escaping from the island leading into his now Re married wife Kelly it made me so sad in parts such as him losing Wilson how i got sad at him losing his ball i have no idea but him losing Kelly and accepting that she cannot be with him really brought emotion towards the film I have to say this film i enjoyed 100 A masterpiece in my eyes

this movie was extraordinary if you love a sad story that doesn t have a particularly happy ending this movie is for you the character development is great if this movie can make me cry over a volleyball i think its pretty good there s so much symbolism Tom Hanks plays a distraught man experiencing a tragedy he spends years alone on an island and returns to find the love of his life gone the casting is perfect and all the acting is wonderful although i found this movie could be a little long and boring some have said nothing really happens this movie isn t very action pact but i strongly recommend this movie

Like a Shakespearean play the different layers of the story cannot be taken in from a one time viewing of Castaway I was looking for a specific film example of some of the Hero Quest plot points from Joseph Voggler and picked up this movie for a second viewing I ended up watching it again with my five year old son When Wilson floated away my son began to cry Then I began to cry Damn my kid got it and I had missed it My son understood how real an imaginary friend is because he was still a child Hanks has a rebirth on the island and is stripped down to an infantile state He becomes a child once again His entire re evolution is fascinating I have watched it at least 8 times since and pick up little pieces that I had not caught before Like a Shakespearean play there are layers to this one Just because the film isn t obvious does not make it slow It s amazing what we expect from movies I expect a story This is a story of becoming a human being and learning to live a genuine life I love it and still tear up Give it a second viewing Look at the symbolism gestures and expressed emotions Pay attention to the details like the birthday card Almost a perfect story Some people simply won t get it I think even the main character Nolan at the beginning of the film would be too deadened to understand it It is only through his tragedy that he becomes a true observer of the gift that life is That might even be one of the layers Bravo

Possible Spoilers Castaway is a movie about loneliness discovery and figuring out what is truly important in life A FedEx employee that works too much ends up having life changing experience when his plane goes down on business trip The main character of this film is Chuck Noland Tom Hanks and he spends most of the movie by himself on a deserted island Because he worked all the time he didn t get to spend much time with the women he loved Kelly Helen Hunt This ends up being one of the main driving forces for Chuck while he is fighting for his survival Chuck has to dig deep from within and conjure up every survival instinct he can think of to stay alive Being stranded alone on island can show you what you re really made of albeit he got lucky he was traveling with FedEx packages that washed up with him After spending years on this island the number one driving force for Chuck was his love Kelly He wanted to get back to her so badly and that s what kept him fighting The sounds in this movie are so wonderful They make you feel like you are in the mist of whatever is on the screen You really get the sense once the plane starts to go down While Chuck is on the inflatable raft you almost feel you are right there with him getting hammered by waves and the raging storm When he gets washed up on the island you get the feeling of emptiness All you hear are the sounds of the sand beneath his feet and the waves crashing in on the shore When he yells and you can hear the hollow of the lonely island you really get the sense of sheer aloneness They way this movie is cut together works perfectly The scenes move seamlessly from one to the next Even when there are time jump scenes the editing team does a great job making it work My favorite editing decision made was that of the rescue scene I won t give it away but you ll know it when you see it Overall I think this film was very well done They did a great job telling their story while keeping things interesting I believe the story they were trying to tell was that you have to dig deep and fight for the ones you love Just like in Cinderella Man even when he thinks he can t do it anymore he thinks of his family and it gives him the necessary drive to keep going This is similar to the determination that Chuck gets when he thinks of Kelly Even though this movie takes place primarily with one actor I think the team that worked on this did a great job and in my opinion it was very well done

Cast Away The critically acclaimed movie Cast Away is a test to one man s psychological and physical will to live It stars Academy Award winner Tom Hanks and that is about it Oh and his buddy Wilson a volleyball Robert Zemeckis is the director who was also the lead man in Forest Gump Hanks and Zemeckis really work well together in this survival flick Cast Away accurately describes man s will to survive even when times become desperate Tom Hanks plays and average man named Chuck Noland who is a supervisor for the corporate shipping business FedEx His girlfriend is Kelly Frears played by Helen Hunt The filmed is based in 1995 where Chuck and Kelly live in Memphis The beginning of the film has him struggling with the daily duties of his FedEx job where is placed in Russia among other places He seems to be a normal man in which he is slightly overweight and has a terrible tooth problem Chuck wishes to marry the love of his life Kelly but business absence has halted the proposal One Christmas day 1995 Chuck gets an unexpected business call in which he has to travel on a plane again Chuck and Kelly exchange gifts in their car before he boards the trip Kelly gives Chuck a compass with a picture of her inside of it This plays an important role later in the plot Like the title of the film implies the plane has some technical difficulties and ends up crashing into the Pacific A water raft ends up saving his life and to his amazement he suffers little injuries Isolated In the middle of the Pacific Chuck floats to the nearest island he stumbles upon His survival skills are immediately tested He has to learn how to hunt how to make fire and how to stay sane Chuck uses some of the FedEx deliveries to help him cope and survive Some of those things are video tapes ice skates a dress a mysterious unopened box and his famous companion a volleyball with a face named Wilson Moreover the island is a tropical one with sand layering the outside And tropical trees and some animals fill the deserted island There is small mountains with rocks and trees covering them Other than some lizards and bugs the island is largely uninhabited as far as we can see Chuck continues to improve on his survival skills while constantly thinking of Kelly and the people at home He talks to a volleyball with a face to give him company He eventually learns how to start a fire Tom Hanks does a great job of showing the frustration his character displays after failing many times He also learns how to hunt and fish on the little island which also takes time In the middle of the movie Chuck appears on the screen with a large beard and long hair We learn that the movie fast forwarded 4 years without any of us seeing what happened in that time While I won t spoil anything Chuck attempts to take his life out to the unpredictable sea desperate to see the world again Of course the rest of the movie will be up to you to see For me Cast Away is a great film to see about resilience will power perseverance you name it But any movie could show those traits How good does Cast Away do though I think it does pretty well It shows how desperate Chuck was when he was starting the fire and how hard it was to take his life venturing out to the sea He even talks to a volleyball in which he pretends the volleyball says stuff back to him But the perseverance the film attempts to show is when he was so lonely for so long The writers make some of the scenes uninspiring like when was hunting and fishing but also very unique when Chuck was talking to Wilson A lot of the movie could be viewed as boring but it is definitely not uneventful Everything that happens in the film means something in the climax and ending The beginning is meh I think it accurately portrays the struggles of his job but how it is nothing compared to what will happen later The initial landing on the island is very interesting I was quite curious as to what an average Joe would do in those desperate measures Tom Hanks is especially well in this role Hanks shows the curiosity and panic of someone with those unlucky circumstances He masters the role of being by himself virtually the whole plot That role would make or break the film and Tom Hanks definitely made it It was an Oscar worthy performance by Hanks There were not a lot of negatives in Cast Away I think the story would not even be as close to as good as it was if it were not for the great performance of Tom Hanks The dialogue between Wilson and Chuck would have been pushed if it was anybody but Hanks He drove the movie forward in bleak scenes and took control over the movie The writers did a fine job of showing the perseverance and willpower it took to try to survive on the island The movie was dependent on Hanks performance and he killed it While the film is Tom Hanks dependent Cast Away is a unique journey through the eyes of a desperate man s will to survive That is why I give it an 8 10

Cast Away was released in 2000 Some are the main characters are Chuck Noland Tom Hanks Kelly Frears Helen Hunt and Ramon Paul Sanchez This film mainly revolves around the main character Chuck who gets stranded on an island after his plane crashes into the ocean This film shows how he tries to survive on this island and try to get himself rescued The film shows how hard it can truly be to try to survive and the emotional toll it would have one someone Of course you have to watch the film to figure out whether Chuck survives this situation or not The theme of Cast Away is pretty straight forward It is one that shows human survival when we are forced to try and survive or die This theme focuses on the idea of the struggle for human dignity Chuck is put in a position of disadvantage and dealt a bad hand when he gets stranded on the island He is fighting against tremendous odds for his survival There are also several other films that have a similar theme to Cast Away s theme 127 Hours is one film that has a similar theme to Cast Away s theme The main character gets dealt a bad hand when getting stuck in the canyons with his arm crushed and stuck His is at a disadvantage and fighting against tremendous odds for his survival just like Chuck was in Cast Away There are a couple of film techniques that have relevance to the film s theme One technique is lighting There is a darker lighting during most of the movie which helps show the significance of the theme If the lighting was bright during the whole film then it would be harder to portray the significance of this theme Sunny and bright usually means happiness You wouldn t want the audience to feel OK and happy during the movie you want them to feel sad nervous anxiety fearful at times This way the audience can have a feeling of being there and have a sense of reality of what is going on in the film and about the theme The second technique is camera angle The camera angles changes from the viewer seeing Chuck and his surroundings to seeing what Chuck is seeing like they are looking through his eyes Interchanging between these camera angles really gets the audience in tune with Chuck and what he is possibly feeling Getting the audience involved like this really helps get the theme of this movie across to the viewers This makes the theme very straight forward A theme of survival against all odds is a great theme that most audience members enjoy and it works great for Cast Away

what a man will do if he s left alone in a place where no one or no thing understands him except HIMSELF i like TOM HANKS remarkable performance and director ZEMECKIS skills are amazing Even though the story is narrated in a slow tempo it s like walking on a sponge path with joyful heart and reasonable mind this is the great experimental emotional movie ever made concerned to my knowledge if it is watched by a person who is suffering from mental illness i bet he will get rock stronger after the completion of the movie as it shows how to develop the awaken giant in yourself who always seeks for your call

review_title: Pretty good movie, with a great theme!
review_comment: Cast Away is based on a man Tom Hanks starring as Chuck Noland who ends up stranded on a lonely island after his FedEx plane crashes and he is the only survivor Chuck ends up being stranded on this island for four years without any human contact The only contact Chuck has during these four years is with his friend Wilson who is a volleyball During this movie they show Chuck finding different ways to survive He builds a raft that helps him sail home The theme of Cast Away is not to take things for granted Chuck leaves behind the love of his life several times to pursue his career He ends up leaving around Christmas and doesn t come back for four years due to his plane crashing When he sees Kelly again after four long years one of the first things he says to her is that he never should have left that night Kelly was distraught when Chuck came back because everyone told her she needed to let him go although she still knew he was alive Because they told her to let go she ended up getting married and having a daughter with someone she did not truly love She described Chuck as the love of her life Wall E is a movie that has the same theme The characters in this particular movie do not take care of their garbage properly and it ends up destroying the earth Wall E shows the beauty of things on earth by saving the items to enjoy for himself When Chuck wakes up on the Island it is really gloomy outside This symbolizes the loneliness that he will be feeling while on the island A motif of Cast Away is when Chuck keeps pulling out the gift that Kelly gave him with her photo in it It is constantly shown throughout the film and displays the emptiness he feels from leaving Kelly that night The film Cast Away Chuck displays his feelings of taking Kelly for granted She wanted to be with him so bad and it really hurt her when Chuck would leave When he leaves around Christmas time he doesn t come back for four years due to the plane crashing Throughout his time on the island you can sense Chuck s loneliness and how much he misses Kelly When he comes back he tells her he never should have left that night The director of Cast Away Rob Zemeckis does an amazing job at displaying the importance of the theme through the whole movie

review_title: Music and Sounds effect our emotions - Review includes a "spoiler"
review_comment: Review includes a spoiler The filmmakers of the film Cast Away illustrated a plethora of different sound effects throughout the film Some examples of these sound effects are the noises of the waves the rain the thunders the wind the horns of the ships the crackling of the wood the coconut droppings even the removal of other sounds you would expect to hear on an island music and much more The film Cast Away is about loneliness relationships and hope sound effects are used to demonstrate these effects In the film Cast Away Tom Hanks as Chuck Noland is FedEx executive that is very punctual and almost neurotic about time This behavior is displayed at the beginning of the movie while he is Russia He returns to his girlfriend Helen Hunt as Kelly Frears in Memphis Tennessee He shows up at her place of employment and greets her in the copier room glad to see each other they hug and kiss She says You are home I love that you are home and they begin to dance Chuck and Kelly then attend a Christmas dinner party that is cut short Kelly gives Chuck a family heirloom pocket watch with his favorite picture of her in it as a gift for Christmas Before he leaves he gives her an engagement ring she says I m scared He walks away saying I ll be right back These scenes are used to illustrate to the viewers how much Kelly and Chuck love each other and how much Chuck has to lose He has successful career girlfriend friends and family While flying over the Pacific Ocean the plane goes through a thunderstorm and crashes into the sea Chuck the lone survivor was saved by an inflatable raft He drifted away from the flames of the crash into the dark sea MUSIC He wakes in the morning to find himself alone and on a deserted island While on the island Chuck uses his primal instincts to survive He had to find shelter food water and even companionship The companion was a volleyball he called Wilson but it was a companion The lack of music background noise helped to reinforce seclusion of the island Chuck was stranded on There are several times in the film that off screen or invisible sounds were used and effectively employed to enlarge the boundaries of the visual frame or to create the mood and atmosphere One example of off screen or invisible sound was during the coconut dropping scenes It wasn t until something fell out of the tree right in front of him that realizes it was coconut The sad truth was he is alone and had just been hearing coconuts fall I believe these sounds along with the others helped in aiding the authenticity of the island environment and the feelings of loneliness and fear felt by Chuck I believe without the sound effects throughout the movie it would have been significantly different The pocket watch gave Chuck hope while he was there for four years Like we stated earlier he is very neurotic about time Chuck used hash marks on the wall to track time which ultimately saved him from the island Yes he was faced with and had to overcome demands of physical and emotional strength but without know the time and when the waves would change he would have never been able to get through the tides After his escape from the island Chuck is floating in the Ocean and experiences another thunderstorm when he wakes up he discovers he has lost his companion Wilson The somber music that played will bring tears your eyes Chuck has lost everything that was something to him from the last four years Once Chuck returned home he discovered the Kelly had moved on and was married ironically to his oral surgeon and she had a child with him After a dramatic re connection and what seems to be a start to rekindling their romance Chuck realizes he has lost her all over again once again it is raining and storming You hear what seems to be the same somber music that was being played when he lost Wilson If I were Chuck I would steer clear from all storms he seems to lose everything during them During a monologue scene Chuck explains to his friend Nick Searcy as Stan I ve got to keep breathing Because tomorrow the sun will rise Who knows what the tide could bring Again the lack of sound in this scene connected you to the emotions being felt by Chuck While on the island there was one only package he had not opened it had angel wings drawn on it In the closing scene of the film Chuck delivers on a sunny bright day this package in Texas The package is being returned to the sender he knocks on the door and no one answers so walks around sees a sculpture of the same angel wings in the yard No one is home so Chuck props it on the screen and leaves a note which reads This package saved my life Chuck leaves and stops at a crossroad to look at a map and a friendly pretty lady about his age stops and says You look lost She gets out of her car and she explains to him where all the roads and intersections lead he thanks her and then she drives away Chuck notices the same angel wings are painted on the back of her truck He looks down at his map and then walks to the center of the crossroads and uplifting music begins to play as the camera focuses on his face and he smiles Music and lack of music play an important part of this film and is used appropriately The music changes and puts you in the emotions of the Chuck and reinforces the loneliness and hope throughout the movie This is by far one of my all time favorites
A movie that could have been perfect whene some major and alot of minor mistake comes up
